placesVisited: Bay Of Islands, Waitangi Treaty Grounds, Aukland, ferry to Waiheke Island, Connell’s Bay, Rotorua, Wellington, Te Papa Museum of New Zealand, Marlborough Sounds guided tour, Kaikoura, whale watching, Christchurch, Southern Alps guided or unguided walking, Dunedin, Otago Peninsula, guided day exploring Stewart Island, Te Anau, nature cruise on Milford Sound, Queenstown, wildlife spotting
generalInfo:
This 19 day tailor made New Zealand holiday introduces you to the incredible scenery, wildlife and rich culture of this Pacific nation. You’ll gain an understanding of both the people and landscape of New Zealand, enjoying an itinerary that’s carefully balanced to reveal all faces of this fascinating country. This is a self drive holiday, with some organised excursions mixed in, so you can travel under your own steam without missing out on insider insights.

The scenery in New Zealand is famously impressive, and the country’s 14 national parks protect this natural heritage. Explore beaches and pristine forests, see jagged peaks and witness dramatic geothermal activity.

Enthusiastic nature lovers will find so much to enjoy on this holiday. You can spot sperm whales and dolphins in Kaikoura and look out for New Zealand’s national bird, the kiwi, on Stewart Island. On the Otago Peninsula, see the royal albatross and penguins who live here.

You will also have the chance to learn more about the indigenous Maori people and their unique culture, visiting the Te Papa museum in Wellington, the Waitangi Treaty Grounds in the Northland, and on a visit to the centre of Maori life and culture, Rotorua.

If you’re keen to try all the activities and excursions detailed in this itinerary, it’s a good idea to avoid travelling during the winter months of June, July and August. The best time to go to is from late spring and through the summer, so that’s from November until the end of March. February is popular with tourists, so can be busy. This proposed itinerary can be tailored to your interests and timings, so please just ask.

dayInfo.description: Arrive into Kerikeri, where you will collect your vehicle and make your way to your seaside accommodation in Paihia.
Visit the historic Waitangi Treaty Grounds, the 'Birthplace of the Nation' and a central region for Maori culture.

Drive leisurely to the Kauri Coast, where you will stay for the night. This evening enjoy a spiritual tour in the Waipoua Forest to learn about the lives of the local Maori and their association with the land.
Drive to Auckland today where you will drop off your vehicle before taking the ferry to Waiheke Island, where you will stay for two nights.

Take a full day tour to explore the adventurous side of Waiheke Island. You will spend the day zip lining the 200 meter dual-flying fox zip line before a guided walk to learn about the islands flora and fauna.

You will take the ferry from Waiheke Island to Auckland, where you will be collected by a representative who will transport you to the Auckland airport for your onward flight to Wellington. Stay two evenings in Wellington.
Spend the day exploring the nation's capital, Wellington. We recommend stopping at the Te Papa Museum to see and learn about Maori history.
Board the InterIslander ferry to Picton, and stay at the Furneaux Lodge to explore the beautiful Queen Charlotte Track and the Marlborough Sounds.
Spend the day hiking on the Queen Charlotte Track or paddle boarding and kayaking from your accommodation.
Return to Picton, and drive to Kaikoura. In the afternoon enjoy a superb whale watching trip, and stay in a treehouse at Hapuku Lodge to support their tree planting efforts.

Drive up to Arthur's Pass in the Southern Alps. Stay at Wilderness Lodge, which was set up to show that ecotourism can contribute to the economy and also protect the environment through nature conservation programs.

Spend the day walking in this pristine region, either guided or unguided. The lodge owners have spent years working with the Department of Conservation to identify rare and endangered plants and birds, which have been reintroduced onto the land around the Lodge.

Drive to Christchurch, and visit the educational and entertaining Antarctic Centre - learn about the ecosystems at risk, and the global efforts to conserve this remote and fascinating area of the world.
Drive to Dunedin, and stay at the historic Fletcher Lodge.
Explore the stunning Otago Peninsula, where you can visit protected colonies of yellow-eyed and blue penguins, sea lions and fur seals, and the world's only mainland albatross colony.
Today make your way from the east coast to the west coast to the small town of Te Anau. Stay at Te Anau Lodge, a restored former convent with a wealth of history and character.

Take a day trip to the glacial-formed Milford Sound for a nature cruise, with hugely knowledgeable on-board geologists and naturalists. You will also visit the fascinating underwater observatory, which due to the unique underwater environment of the Sound allows you to view precious corals, sea stars and fish which are usually only seen by divers.

Drive to magnificent Queenstown, where you will end your trip. Explore some true 'Lord of the Rings' country, visit historic gold-mining townships, or simply sit back and take in the stunning lake views against the backdrop of the Remarkables mountain range. Stay at The Dairy, a 1920s corner store, now a characterful and lovingly restored guesthouse.
Fly home from Queenstown.

tourName: New Zealand self drive tour, 23 days
generalInfo: This comprehensive 23-day self-drive itinerary explores the North and South Island’s iconic destinations, starting in Auckland and finishing in Christchurch, with plenty of two-night stays to ensure you really experience New Zealand. From the vibrant city of Auckland to the tropical Bay of Islands, you’ll also visit the cultural mecca of Rotorua and Wellington City before crossing the Cook Strait to Marlborough at the top of the South Island. Kaikoura and its famous wildlife can be explored before continuing south towards the Southern Alps and Mt Cook National Park. Milford Sound is sure to be a highlight along with Queenstown and the West Coast Glaciers before returning to Christchurch via the world famous Tranz Alpine train.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Auckland! Meet your private driver who will give you an information pack including maps and driving instructions, then take you to your hotel.
The day is yours to explore the 'City of Sails'. Maybe cruise the harbour or take a wine tour. We can recommend plenty of exciting things to do.
Cross the harbour bridge and head north to the blue waters of the Bay of Islands. The trip from Auckland takes around 3.5 hours but give yourself some leeway for stops and sightseeing.

You have the day to discover the gems of the Bay of Islands, take to the water on a dolphin cruise or explore the history. We recommend a visit to Waitangi Treaty Grounds and seeing a cultural performance.

Cross rural Northland to the Hokianga Harbour, where you'll head south along the Kauri Coast. Head south into the Waipoua Forest, home to giant Kauri trees. Allow time for one of a number of short walks available in the area.

Pass back through Auckland and onto the rolling green farmland and the rich dairy pasture of the Waikato. Continue to Rotorua, with its natural hot springs, boiling mud pools and steaming geysers, sitting within one of the worlds most active volcanic regions.

Your day in Rotorua could be spent immersed in culture or sampling the many adventures to be had. We recommend an evening at Mitai Maori Village, to give you an awe-inspiring introduction to the indigenous Maori culture.
Today is filled with fantastic scenery including Lake Taupo home to New Zealand’s largest lake, the Desert Road and the Kapiti coast to Wellington.

Cross the Cook Strait by ferry and get your camera ready for the amazing Marlborough Sounds scenery as you near Picton. The journey between Wellington and Picton takes around 3 hours and has been described as 'one of the most beautiful ferry rides in the world'.

Drive across the 'dry hills' of Marlborough and head towards one of the most spectacular coastlines of the South Island, the Kaikoura Coast. Here you can book yourself onto New Zealand's only marine based whale watching tours, or an Albatross Encounter.
Today you travel down the coast before heading inland through the North Canterbury wine region - the Waipara Valley and on to Christchurch.
Explore the ever-changing city of Christchurch, or maybe take a day trip to Akaroa. You can drive an hour in any direction to ski, mountain bike, wine taste, whale-watch, bungy jump or play golf!
Today you'll enjoy a scenic drive through the heart of the South Island, crossing the vast Canterbury plains and the MacKenzie Country.

Leave the alpine region of Mount Cook National Park and travel past Twizel, one of the locations for the Lord of the Rings films. Drive through the Waitaki Valley following the Waitaki River to the east coast, where you'll turn south for Dunedin.

Discover the diverse wildlife that make their home on the Otago Peninsula, follow the coast to New Zealand's only castle, Larnach Castle. On your way back be sure to head to the Peninsula to see the largest mainland Albatross colony in the world.
Travel through the rich farmland of South Otago and Southland to reach Te Anau, gateway to Fiordland National Park and Milford Sound.

Journey along the road to Milford Sound with some of the most beautiful and iconic scenery in the country. From crystal clear lakes and towering mountains to lush glacier formed meadows, this area is dramatic and unyielding.
Travel through rolling Southland countryside then follow Lake Wakatipu where the mountain range towers over your approach into the adventure capital of New Zealand, Queenstown.

Explore Queenstown or try one of the many adrenalin activities on offer. Or for those not seeking any hair-raising thrills, simply take a leisurely lakeside stroll or ride the gondola for breath-taking views, or head down the Gibbston Valley wine trail to sample some of the region’s best Pinot.

Take the Crown Range Road to Wanaka, the gateway to Mt Aspiring National Park and stunning Lake Wanaka, before travelling the spectacular Haast Pass to the West Coast. Allow time for photo stops along the way!

Discover the Franz Josef Glacier and view the incredible sight of this frozen river as it winds its way through ancient carved valleys. To see the ice from a viewpoint you can walk along the valley floor to the terminal face without a guide. However, to go on the glacier itself you must take a licensed helicopter tour.

Drive north along the stunning West Coast Road to Greystone, approximately 2 hours. Drop your rental car off and board one of the world's great train journeys, the TranzAlpine Scenic Train to Christchurch. From the comfort of your carriage see lush beech forest, deep river valleys and the spectacular peaks of the Southern Alps.
Say goodbye to New Zealand today with a private transfer to the Christchurch airport for your flight home.

tourName: New Zealand self drive tour
generalInfo:
Striking landscapes, lively cities, romantic vineyards and rugged coastline – New Zealand is overflowing with natural beauty and unique outdoor activities. On this luxury self-drive adventure tour, you’ll take in the highlights of both North and South Island, with an action-packed itinerary full of treks, trail, water sports, helicopter rides, wildlife watching opportunities and picture-perfect countryside.

Starting with scenic Taupo, you’ll hike to the cascades of Huka Falls, experience true enchantment in the Waitomo glowworm caves and soak in bubbling hot springs created by volcanic geysers. Then, you’ll cruise around the gorgeous Marlborough Sounds, where you can kayak with seals and then tramp along the famous Queen Charlotte Track for breath-taking views of glittering green waters and forest-fringed coastlines.

Next, drive along the picturesque Pacific coastline to Kaikoura. Here, there are whale watching opportunities, as well encounters with playful dolphins in their natural habitat. Your tour ends in Queenstown, with helicopter rides over Fjord National Park and boat trips around Milford Sound, plus fantastic wining and dining options in the city.

This whirlwind Kiwi adventure showcases the best that New Zealand has to offer, promising lasting memories and once-in-a-lifetime travel moments.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Auckland - Arriving in Auckland, you'll be met by a travel representative and you'll be transferred to your accommodation and have to day to relax and explore as your wish. Conveniently located within easy walking distance of Auckland’s bustling shopping, arts, dining and entertainment precincts and opposite the New Zealand International Convention Centre.

Drive from Auckland to Taupo – Today, you'll collect your rental car in Auckland and set off for a stop at the magical Waitomo Caves, complete with glowworm grottos – an incredible introduction to New Zealand. At Taupo, check in to Whakaipo Lodge, a luxury property hidden in the bushland, flanked by towering mountains and serene lake waters. Unwind with a home-cooked meal made using local ingredients and a glass of renowned New Zealand wine.

Taupo at Leisure – Your days in Taupo are at your leisure with many spectacular sites to visit. The pounding waters of Huka Falls (“huka” is the Maori word for foam) are a sight to behold, with a whopping 22,000 litres of water spilling over the ledge every second, plunging eight metres into a churning gorge along the Waikato River. Watch the cascades from the viewing platforms or take a one-hour forest trail, following the river and the roar of the falls. Take a walk between Little Acacia Bay and Rangatira Point or stop for a lakeside picnic along the Great Lake Walkway between Two Mile Bay and Five Mile Bay.

Transfer to Marlborough Sounds – Drop off your hire car and take an internal flight from Taupo to Blenheim, where you’ll take a private transfer to Picton, followed by a private water taxi to Lochmara Lodge, located on the sandy shores of Lochmara Bay. This luxury resort is the perfect base for nature trails, water sports such as kayaking and paddleboarding, wildlife tours and simple beachfront relaxation. Don’t miss a pamper at the lodge’s bathhouse and massage suite. At night, New Zealand’s dark and clear skies are perfect for stargazing, while the phosphorescence in the water makes for a surreal nighttime paddling and swimming experience.

Exploring Marlborough Sounds – Explore the waters of Marlborough Sounds to discover sandy coves and perfect picnic spots. The four main water bodies are Queen Charlotte, Kenepuru, Pelorus and Mahau, which hold 50 different protected nature reserves and an abundance of wildlife. Kayak with seals, spot dolphins and orcas on a cruise, or try birdwatching in the forests and on the beaches. Explore the islands of Motuara, Long, Blumine and Allports all having historic sites, here you can enjoy a dish of freshly caught seafood and a glass of delicious Marlborough wine is a must.

Hiking the Queen Charlotte Track – Today, you are free to explore Marlborough Sounds, however we highly recommend hiking a section of the famous Queen Charlotte Track. The hike involves a 71-kilometre trail offers endless views of glistening bays, wild forest and historic points of interest; the track starts at the location where South Island Maori and Europeans first met and where Captain James Cook sailed into Ship Cove in 1770.

Transfer to Kaikoura – Return to Picton via water taxi, then pick up your next hire car for a scenic drive to Kaikoura, along the way stop off in Blenheim, crossing the Wairau Plains past vineyards and orchards, Blenheim is the heart of wine-growing Marlborough. Carry on your journey to Kaikora where you'll be staying at the Kaikoura Boutique Hotel. The hotel is housed in an historic building right on the waterfront and features stylish rooms, as well as a champagne bar. Be sure to try the local delicacy of crayfish.

Exploring Kaikoura – Kaikoura is an underwater treasure trove of marine life, providing opportunities for encounters with whales, dolphins, seals, albatross and much more. Dive, snorkel and cruise for glimpses of majestic sperm whales and encounters with sunbathing seal colonies, then hop on a fishing charter to try your hand at contributing to the catch of the day.

Exploring Kaikoura – Join an eco-friendly dolphin tour to encounter playful pods of dusky dolphins, as well as the opportunity to swim with these creatures in a responsible way. Watch the dolphins show off their acrobatics in numbers that can be up to 1,000 strong. Back on land, the hike up to Mount Fyffe offers spectacular panoramic views, while a wildlife flight over Kaikoura provides a bird's eye view of the breath-taking natural landscape.

Transfer to Queenstown – Drive from Kaikoura to Christchurch Airport, for a quick flight over to Queenstown. Here, you’ll pick up your next hire car and journey on to the five-star Queenstown Park Boutique Hotel, with mountain views that will take your breath away.

Helicopter Tour & Milford Sound Cruise – Take in humbling alpine scenery with a helicopter ride across the Queenstown region, flying over forests and farmlands into Fiordland National Park, an area filled with glittering lakes and tumbling waterfalls. Landing at Milford Sound, you’ll take a cruise through the valleys, staring up at towering peaks and looking out across the serene waters. On your return flight back to the base, you’ll also be able to see epic ice shelves, with a stopover on a glacier for magnificent views and awe-inspiring photo opportunities.

Exploring Queenstown – Take the short 1.5-kilometre Queenstown Hill Time Walk for 360-degree views over the region or hop on the city’s Skyline Gondola; visit the charming town of Glenorchy for hiking trails around Lake Sylvan, then participate in a winery tour to sample world-renowned vinos and vintages. For adventurous travellers, there’s skydiving, bungy jumping, rafting, zip-lining, canyoning, paragliding and heli-mountain biking.

Departure from Queenstown – Sadly, your New Zealand adventure comes to an end. However, this action-packed itinerary is sure to have you leave with wonderful memories and amazing stories from your trip, as well as some truly unique and special experiences.

tourName: New Zealand small group tour, 23 days
placesVisited: Auckland, Russell, Waitangi Treaty Grounds, Hot Water Beach, Rotorua, Waimangu Volcanic Valley, Lake Taupo, Napier, Wellington, Nelson, Abel Tasman National Park, Westland National Park, Lake Matheson, Wanaka, Milford Sound, Queenstown, Arrowtown, Hooker Valley Trail, Christchurch
generalInfo:
In just 23 days this New Zealand small group tour takes you on an exciting journey around the country’s dramatic landscape and lively cities. Starting on North Island you’ll explore the stunning Bay of Islands, immerse yourself in Maori history at the Waitangi Treaty Grounds, and see geothermal activity up close at Rotorua, as well as exploring the dynamic city of Wellington.

Highlights of South Island include cruising Abel Tasman National Park, journeying through the jaw-dropping scenery of Milford Sound, indulging in thrill-seeking activities at adventure capital Queenstown, and spending the night on a local farm enjoying traditional Kiwi hospitality.

All transport, accommodation and entrance fees are included, and you’ll be guided by local experts along the way.

dayInfo.description: Haere mai – welcome! Arrive into Auckland and spend the afternoon and evening getting to know the ‘City of Sails’ and your fellow travellers.

Heading north, we pause to marvel at a remnant of ancient Kauri forest from an elevated walkway. At Paihia we enjoy a guided visit to the birthplace of the nation, the fascinating Waitangi Treaty Grounds. We arrive in Russell, the first capital city of New Zealand, by ferry.

Today, the choice is yours. Either travel by special coach along amazing 90 Mile Beach to sacred Cape Reinga (also includes lunch) OR enjoy a cruise towards Cape Brett Lighthouse and the Hole in the Rock, with the chance of dolphin-spotting, before a guided tour of historic Russell.

We return to Auckland to discover its vibrant harbourside, charming village neighbourhoods and panoramic views, before a guided tour of the excellent Auckland Museum to learn more about Pacific culture.

Wave goodbye to the City of Sails as we cross the Hauraki Gulf by ferry to the Coromandel Peninsula. On landing, we take a narrow-gauge railway trip before our coach delivers us to beautiful Mercury Bay.

If the tide is right, scoop your own ‘spa’ pool out of the sand at Hot Water Beach, before walking to beautiful Cathedral Cove. A water taxi takes us to Hahei, then we travel to Cooks Beach, where the ‘Endeavour’ dropped anchor in 1769. Now you can choose to take a ferry ride to Whitianga and walk to the hotel, or travel back with our driver.

We turn inland and stretch our legs on an easy bush walk before arriving at the geothermal centre of North Island, which is also the heart of Maori culture. Our private tour of Te Puia includes bubbling mud, indigenous art and kiwi conservation.

Either explore Waimangu Volcanic Valley on foot and by boat to experience this ever-changing landscape close-up, OR Tolkien fans may take a trip to the Hobbiton™ Film Set. This evening, we all experience an amazing Maori welcome and Hangi (feast).

Pausing at mighty Lake Taupo, we head to Hawke’s Bay on the east coast for a walking tour of Art Deco Napier. This evening, we enjoy the best of New Zealand cuisine (with a glass of wine) at the Mission Estate Winery.

Driving through the Wairarapa ranges we arrive in the breezy capital city, known for its creative industries and great coffee! We take the cable car from Kelburn before visiting Te Papa, one of the world’s top museums.

All aboard the Interisland ferry to navigate the Cook Strait to South Island! Back on our coach, we pause for a wine tasting in Marlborough before arriving in Nelson, known for its arts and crafts and artisan food culture.

The best way to discover this pristine coastal wilderness is by boat and on foot. Today’s included options are: a half-day cruise around this jewel-like coast, OR a cruise followed by one of two self-guided beach and bush walks.
We travel through enchanting Nelson Lakes National Park on the Buller Gorge road, carved through virgin forest by 19th century miners, to arrive at Punakaiki to see its extraordinary rock formations.

Pause in the gold rush town of Hokitika, before heading to glacier country. The Fox and Franz Josef Glaciers flow almost to sea level, making them unusually accessible. Viewing options include helicopter flights (at own cost).

We take the coach into Milford Sound. A beautifully scenic route, with plenty of opportunities for photo taking. Enjoy a morning cruise out on the Sound followed by guided short walks with an experienced and knowledgeable nature guide.
Leaving Fiordland National Park behind, we take a short journey via Kingstown and Lake Wakitipu to Queenstown ‘Switzerland of the Southern Hemisphere’ and our base for the next two nights.
Travelling via historic Arrowtown, beneath the Remarkables range of mountains and along the shore of Lake Wakatipu, we arrive at the gateway to Fiordland National Park: Te Anau.

The journey there, through rainforest, is as spectacular as the destination: Milford Sound! Top this with a memorable cruise past Mitre Peak to the Tasman Sea (picnic lunch on board) before ending the day in Queenstown.

This sophisticated resort offers something for everyone. The day is free for you to be a thrill-seeker or a wine-taster, to ride a gondola or cruise on a vintage steam ship: the options (at own cost) are endless!

With the Southern Alps on our left, we cross Otago and travel beside lovely Lake Pukaki before driving up to Mt Cook Village, where Sir Edmund Hillary climbed his country’s highest peak before going on to conquer Everest. Overnight at Twizel.

We visit a friendly homestead to try our hand at making New Zealand’s famous Pavlova. Suitably refreshed, there’s time for a photo beside milky-blue Lake Tekapo. Choose a small-town hotel with restaurant, OR (in small groups) a rural Homestay for a home-cooked meal and overnight with a local family.

Post-earthquake Christchurch mixes colonial charm with cutting-edge architecture, re-inventing itself in typical Kiwi style. ‘Edwardian’ boatmen take us for a punt on the River Avon before we hop on a tram. Our farewell dinner features the best of local cuisine.
Sadly, our trip ends after breakfast. We transfer you to the airport for your flight, or ask us to extend your stay with tailor-made arrangements by car or TranzAlpine rail.

tourName: New Zealand South Island self drive holiday
generalInfo:
This 10 day tour takes you to the icons of the South Island, with extra nights in Christchurch, Fiordland and Queenstown you'll have time to discover the charms of each destination. You begin with a journey past the mountains of the Southern Alps and turquoise waters of alpine lakes before arriving into Mt. Cook National Park. Next you venture further south to Te Anau, gateway to Fiordland National Park. Here you’ll explore the pristine wilderness on a Milford Sound nature cruise. In Queenstown, the Adventure Capital, there’s time to enjoy the scenery and endless activities on offer before returning to Christchurch via the magnificent West Coast Glaciers.

Included within this package
Accommodation for 9 nights staying in Hotel 4 star
Rental car hire: included as specified for the duration of the tour package.
Rental car insurance included: Fully inclusive with variable excess/deductible.
Rental car inclusions: GPS navigation, unlimited kms, airport/ferry terminal fees, additional drivers.
Tour pack: Includes detailed driving instructions, maps, guide books and much more.
Private transfer Christchurch Airport to your accommodation
Travel guide and in-country support
Private transfer accommodation to Christchurch Airport
Te Anau Glowworm Caves
Milford Sound Cruise with RealNZ
TSS Earnslaw Gourmet BBQ Dinner Cruise
Private Transfer Christchurch Train Station to your accommodation
TranzAlpine Scenic Train: Greymouth to Christchurch
9 breakfasts, 1 lunch, 1 special dinner

dayInfo.description: Arrive into Christchurch City Accommodation: Sudima Christchurch City
Take the day to explore the ever changing city of Christchurch. Accommodation: Sudima Christchurch City Meals included: Breakfast
Today you'll enjoy a scenic drive through Canterbury and the MacKenzie Country Accommodation: Hermitage Hotel, Wakefield Wing Superior Room Meals included: Breakfast

Follow the dry lands to Lindis Pass which leads into Central Otago, then through the Kawerau Gorge to Queenstown and south to Te Anau Accommodation: Distinction Luxmore Hotel Meals included: Breakfast
Journey along the magnificent Milford Road to your cruise on Milford Sound Accommodation: Distinction Luxmore Hotel Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch
Travel through rolling Southland countryside then follow Lake Wakatipu to Queenstown Accommodation: Millennium Hotel Queenstown Meals included: Breakfast, Speciality Dinner

The day is yours to discover all the scenic spots and fun activities on offer in Queenstown. From adrenaline fuelled activities to enjoying the breath taking scenery from the shore of Lake Wakatipu. Accommodation: Millennium Hotel Queenstown Meals included: Breakfast
Take the Crown Range Road to Wanaka before travelling the spectacular Haast Pass to the West Coast Accommodation: Scenic Hotel Franz Josef Glacier Meals included: Breakfast
Drive north along the stunning West Coast Road and take the TranzAlpine train to Christchurch Accommodation: Sudima Christchurch City Meals included: Breakfast
Depart Christchurch today.

tourName: New Zealand South Island self drive tour, Lakes & Alps
generalInfo: This circular 9-day tour starts and finishes in Christchurch. You will journey south through the Mackenzie high country past Lake Tekapo before arriving into Mt. Cook National Park. Then to Queenstown for two nights, with time to relax and enjoy the countless activities on offer here. The West Coast Glaciers are next and two nights allow time to enjoy one of the many guided walk or scenic flight options. Return to Christchurch aboard the world famous Tranz Alpine Scenic Train. Along the way you'll stay in premium accommodation with a personalised touch.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Christchurch City! On arrival you will be given an information pack including maps and driving instructions, before your private driver takes you to your guesthouse.

Collect your car this morning, then the day is yours to explore Christchurch or maybe a day trip to Akaroa. You can drive an hour in any direction to ski, mountain bike, wine taste, whale-watch, bungy jump or play golf!

Today you'll enjoy a scenic drive through the heart of the South Island, crossing the vast Canterbury plains and the MacKenzie Country. Driving time for this leg is approximately 4 hours. Stop at the picturesque lakeside town of Tekapo, then follow the road and take in the view of Aoraki Mt Cook (New Zealand's tallest mountain) from the shores of Lake Pukaki.

Leaving the alpine region of Mount Cook, follow the dry lands to Lindis Pass, one of New Zealand's highest roads with a summit of 971 metres, leading into Central Otago's gold mining settlements. You'll travel to the lakeside town and gliding capital of New Zealand, and follow the road through towards the Gibbston Valley, one of New Zealand's premier wine growing regions, before arriving in Queenstown for 2 nights’ stay. Driving time approximately 3 hours.

Explore Queenstown or try one of the many adrenaline activities on offer. Or for those not seeking any hair-raising thrills, simply take a leisurely lakeside stroll or ride the gondola for breath-taking views, or head down the Gibbston Valley wine trail to sample some of the region’s best Pinot.

From Queenstown cross the Crown Range Road to the gateway to Mt Aspiring National Park, where you’ll see the Alpine town of Wanaka with its stunning lake. Continue through the spectacular Haast Pass to the West Coast. Allow approximately 4 and a half hours, plus time for photo stops along the way!

Discover the Franz Josef Glacier and view the incredible sight of this frozen river as it winds its way through ancient carved valleys. To see the ice from a viewpoint you can walk along the valley floor to the terminal face without a guide. However, to go on the glacier itself you must take a licensed helicopter tour.

Today you’ll head north through the historic gold mining region of Hokitika, known for its Greenstone (Pounamu), the iconic stone emblem of New Zealand. Then along the stunning West Coast Road. Driving time, approximately 2 hours. Drop your rental car off and board one of the world's great train journeys, the TranzAlpine Scenic Train to Christchurch. From the comfort of your carriage see lush beech forest, deep river valleys and the spectacular peaks of the Southern Alps.
Depart Christchurch today with a transfer to the airport. Alternatively continue your vacation in New Zealand and see the North Island with one of our many tours...

tourName: New Zealand South Island self drive tour
generalInfo:
This stunning three-week tailor-made adventure takes in New Zealand’s South Island, which is well known for its beautiful scenery, adventurous activities and native wildlife. Begin in the Abel Tasman National Park; well-known for being the sunniest place in the country and the perfect opportunity to start you trip by exploring hidden sandy beaches and secret coves by kayak, using human power rather than engines to reduce your impact on the environment. There are numerous hiking trails throughout the park and the famed multi-day Abel Tasman track heads right through the dense undergrowth while awarding you with glimpses of the turquoise waters.

Heading south through the flat vineyards of Blenheim you will continue to Kaikoura, famed for its abundance of marine mammals and birds. In Maori, the town’s name translates as ‘to eat crayfish,’ which are a huge resource in the nutrient rich waters. Here in Kaikoura, you’ll have the chance to swim with dusky dolphins, be awe-inspired by breaching sperm whales and spot graceful Albatross gliding overhead. Continuing the ocean theme, bi-pass the hustle and bustle of Christchurch and spend a little time in the quaint little French village of Akaroa, nestled in the centre of a volcanic crater. There are some lovely hidden spots for hikes and picnics like Le Bons Bay and Pigeon Bay. The real highlight here is to spot the world’s smallest species of dolphin, the Hector’s dolphin. These animals are so intelligent and love swimming circles around the boat.

Your journey continues into the heart of the Southern Alps to the rich glacial lakes of Tekapo and Pukaki, where Aoraki (Mount Cook) dominates the landscape. This area is all about immersing yourself in the wilderness and the natural beauty. There are some stunning hikes such as the hike to Mount John in Tekapo along with the Hooker Valley track at Mount Cook itself. This area, the Mackenzie Basin, is a registered as a Dark Sky Reserve meaning you could see the dazzling Milky Way, Southern Cross and many other constellations on a clear night.

Continuing through the Alps, Lake Wanaka is situated on the edge of the Mount Aspiring National Park and therefore an excellent destination for natural beauty and some fantastic hikes. Some of our favourites are Roy’s Peak, Iron Hill and the Diamond Lake track. In this sleepy alpine town, you can take a leisurely cycle ride along the banks of the Clutha River on a state-of-the-art e-bike or visit a predator free island in the middle of the lake to learn more about re-introducing native bird species. Being on foot or cycling around the area can really help reduce your carbon footprint.

From Lake Wanaka, you’ll meander through the winelands of Central Otago and the Gibbston Valley before reaching Queenstown and the mighty Lake Wakatipu. The scenery really doesn’t disappoint with views over the Crown Ranges and onwards to Glenorchy. Here you can explore the native beech forests during a guided hike on the Routeburn track or visit some of the filming locations for the Lord of the Rings. From Queenstown, you can access the mighty Fiordland National Park and spend the night sailing on Doubtful Sound, on the Fiordland Navigator. This magical experience will afford you the chance to spot transient Humpback whales, dolphins, New Zealand fur seals and even the elusive Fiordland Crested Penguins. Waking up in the peace and serenity of the Sound is a once in a lifetime experience. From Queenstown, you’ll depart home and look back at an incredible trip with fond memories.

dayInfo.description: Today you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Auckland.
On-board your international outbound flight to Auckland.

This morning, you'll fly down to Nelson and begin your South Island adventure. You will be collected from the airport and transported to the Abel Tasman National Park, where you will board a small boat cruise to your lodge. Here, you can immerse yourself in the wilderness for the next three nights as the park is only accessible on foot, by kayak or by boat.

Today, head out for a half-day guided kayaking tour around Abel Tasman National Park, one of the best spots to sea kayak in New Zealand, as the waters and bays are calm, sheltered and great for beginners. Keep your eyes peeled for native birdlife, seals and dolphins.

Abel Tasman National Park is well known for hiking in New Zealand, spend the day at leisure exploring one of the many hiking trails around the national park or relax at your accommodation’s private beach.

Depart the Abel Tasman National Park by cruise to Kaiteriteri, where you will be met by a private driver who will transport you to the small seaside town of Picton. Once you arrive in Picton, you will be met by a water taxi who will transport you to your Marlborough Sounds accommodation, where you will spend the next three nights.

Explore the Marlborough Sounds and its sheltered inlets and clear waters on your own today. You can take a small group boat trip to spot marine life in the area, or you can head out on a full-day hike down the Queen Charlotte Track.

Spend another day at leisure around the Marlborough Sounds. We recommend taking out the lodge’s kayaks or paddleboards to explore the sandy bays that surround the lodge, or you can relax and take in the quiet natural surroundings.

Late this morning, you will take a water taxi from your Marlborough Sounds accommodation back to Picton where you will meet the afternoon TranzCoastal train down to Kaikoura. Upon arrival in Kaikoura, you will be transported to your accommodation for the next two nights.

Spend the morning kayaking along the Kaikoura coastline, where you are guaranteed to see seals and sheer cliff faces. If you are lucky, you could see dusky dolphins, albatross, blue penguins, or even a whale.
Enjoy the morning at leisure around Kaikoura before boarding the TranzCoastal train to Christchurch, where you will spend the next two nights.

Make your way to the International Antarctic Centre, near the Christchurch airport, to explore life in Antarctica for both humans and wildlife. You can spend time in the “Storm Dome” to experience the feel of a winter in Antarctica, or you can take the Hägglund all-terrain vehicle to feel what it’s like to drive across the ice. This museum is perfect for all ages who want to learn more about the environment and humans’ impact on it.

This morning, take a shared transfer to the TranzAlpine train which you will take from Christchurch to Arthur’s Pass, the middle of the South Island and the small town that is situated in the Southern Alps. Once you get settled into your room, you have the rest of the afternoon to relax or take a tour of the property and its sheep farm.
Today is at leisure to hike and explore the Southern Alps, the shingle-filled riverbeds, vast beech forests, and the small town of Arthur’s Pass.

Late this morning, you will be transported to the train to take you from Arthur’s Pass to Greymouth, where you will collect your vehicle and head south to Franz Josef. Spend the next two nights exploring Franz and Fox Glaciers, two huge valleys of ice that almost run to the sea.

Take a two-hour hiking tour through the beautiful podocarp forest and past glacier rivers to the Franz Josef glacier terminal face. Your guide will talk through the glaciology and geology of the region and talk about the local flora and fauna. The rest of the afternoon is at leisure to visit the local hot springs or to go hiking around Lake Matheson.

Say goodbye to Franz Josef and drive south past Fox Glacier before passing over Haast Pass and descending into pristine rainforests and Mt Aspiring National Park. You will arrive at Lake Wanaka in the early afternoon and will have the rest of the afternoon to check in to your accommodation and explore the small town of Wanaka.

Enjoy a half-day cycling tour from Albert Town down the Clutha River, New Zealand’s second-longest river. This tour is perfect for anyone who wants to explore the beautiful landscape whilst feeling the wind on your face.
Today is spent at leisure around Wanaka going to Puzzling World, going on a hike up Mt Iron, or relaxing at your accommodation before you depart home.
Arrive home today to complete your journey.

tourName: New Zealand South Island tour, 9 days
generalInfo:
With its breathtaking landscapes, heart-pounding thrills, and endless fun, New Zealand’s South Island is everything you’ve ever dreamed of and more. From the lively city of Christchurch to the towering peaks of Mount Cook and beyond, you’ll experience the very best of this stunning region, with a few hidden gems along the way. Cruise through the jaw-dropping Milford Sound, jet boat through the epic scenery of Lord of the Rings country, explore the adventure hubs of Wanaka and Queenstown, hike to iconic viewpoints, and so much more! Opt for the NZ Intro South work add-on, and we'll also help you kickstart your adventure with all the essentials, including finding work in New Zealand. With an awesome group leader from the moment your trip starts, an instant group of friends to share your adventure, amazing accommodation and so much included. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!

HIGHLIGHTS:
– Explore Aoraki/Mount Cook National Park
– Kayak on Lake Wanaka
– Experience the thrill of Queenstown
– Sail through the awe-inspiring beauty of Milford Sound
– Speed through rugged canyons on an exhilarating jet boat ride
– Get unlimited assistance securing a paid job in New Zealand with the NZ Intro South work add-on


INCLUDED:

? 8 Meals
? All Transport (Excluding Airport Transfer)
? Help Before You Go

? Lake Tekapo Hot Pools

? Kayaking on Lake Wanaka

? Help with Onward Travel

dayInfo.description: Arrive and meet your group – Kia ora! Landing in Christchurch, we’ll meet you at our hostel to settle in and refresh. We recommend arriving before 3pm as that is when the tour starts.
Christchurch Orientation & Lake Tekapo – Explore the lively city of Christchurch, where history and culture come to life around every corner, before heading to the stunning beauty of Lake Tekapo!

Lake Tekapo – Today we’ll take a hike up Mt John where we’ll get 360-degree views of the Southern Alps before soaking our tired muscles in some hot pools. Later, our team will help make sure you’ve got everything sorted for living and working in NZ, and get you signed up to our NZ Jobs Program.
Aoraki/Mt Cook National Park – This morning we'll make our way to Wanaka. This afternoon we’ll stretch our limbs hiking for unforgettable views of Aoraki/Mt Cook, the highest mountain in New Zealand.

Discover Wanaka - Today we’ll check out the highlights of Wanaka, including going kayaking on the stunning Lake Wanaka and discovering the famous Wanaka Tree. We’ll later hike up Mount Iron for stunning views of the local area including The Pisa range, Upper Clutha Basin and the mesmerising Southern Alps.
Explore Queenstown – Today we’ll travel to the beautiful city of Queenstown. We'll have some time to explore this epic city.

Milford Sound Cruise - Leaving Queenstown, today we’re heading to the majestic Milford Sound. We’ll hop on a boat to cruise around the fjord, feeling tiny amongst sheer cliff faces, ancient forests, and plunging waterfalls.

Check Out – This morning your unforgettable South Island adventure comes to an end. Check out and journey home, stay in Queenstown, or continue the next leg of your travels with the new friends you’ve made! Whatever your plans, we’ll be there to help every step of the way.

tourName: New Zealand tours, North Island
generalInfo: This tour takes in the stunning sights of North Island, on a journey past ancient kauri trees to the sparkling Pacific waters of the Bay of Islands.  Further south, you’ll visit the Art Deco town of Napier, and enjoy the wonderful wines of the Hawkes Bay region, before arriving in Wellington, “the coolest little capital in the world”.

dayInfo.description: Auckland Haere mai – welcome! Arrive into Auckland where you will be met and transferred to your accommodation. The rest of the day is yours to relax exploring the ‘City of Sails’. M Social Hotel, Auckland

Auckland to Bay of Islands (B) We leave via the iconic Harbour Bridge and break our journey at Reed Memorial Park to walk through part of an original kauri forest on an elevated canopy walkway. We also visit the picturesque Whangarei Falls formed more than 2 million years ago, before continuing to the Bay of Islands. Regarded as the birthplace of New Zealand this region is rich in both Maori culture and early European history. We are welcomed to the Waitangi Treaty Grounds, to learn the story of the signing of the 1840 treaty between Maori tribes and British settlers, visit the magnificent carved meeting house, the interactive museum and the war canoe (waka). After our visit we take a ferry to the seaside village of Russell where we spend two nights at the historic Duke of Marlborough Hotel. Duke of Marlborough Hotel, Russell - 2 nights

Bay of Islands (B) Today you have the choice of two excursions: a) Discover the Far North of New Zealand Journey along the magnificent 90 Mile Beach to Cape Reinga the very tip of New Zealand, where the Tasman Sea collides with the Pacific Ocean. This full day tour includes a visit to the ancient Puketi Kauri forest and lunch. b) Enjoy a Hole in the Rock cruise On the way to the Cape Brett Lighthouse, now hold your breath as the skipper skilfully navigates through the famous Hole in the Rock and into Grand Cathedral Cave (conditions permitting). Return to Russell to meet a local guide for an insight into this historic town’s rip-roaring past!

Bay of Islands to Auckland (B) Head south through rural towns and past delightful beaches before arriving in Auckland; New Zealand's largest and most cosmopolitan city to enjoy a sightseeing tour of the 'City of Sails' including panoramic views from Bastion Point; trendy Parnell Village; the lovely bays of the waterfront drive; and the vibrant Viaduct Harbour area. We also enjoy a guided tour of the Auckland Museum which gives an excellent introduction to the artistic legacy and cultures of the indigenous peoples of the Pacific. M Social Hotel, Auckland

Auckland to Coromandel Peninsula (B) Wave goodbye to Auckland as we depart by boat across the Hauraki Gulf passing many volcanic islands to the Coromandel Peninsula. Visit the nearby Driving Creek Railway climbing 120m on a narrow-gauge line to the ‘Eyefull’ Tower for panoramic views of the surrounding countryside and back over the Hauraki Gulf. Drive east across the Peninsula through beautiful scenery to reach the resort of Whitianga on Mercury Bay. Oceans Resort, Whitianga – 2 nights

Coromandel Peninsula (B) Enjoy the white cliffs, golden beaches, turquoise waters and green forests of the Coromandel today. Rightly famous is Hot Water Beach, where warm springs bubble up through the sand, and when the tide is right you can dig out your very own ‘spa’ pool for a wallow in the warm waters. Walk down into Cathedral Cove – your efforts are rewarded with one of the most photogenic beaches in New Zealand. Take a water taxi back to Hahei where your driver will be waiting to take you to Cooks Beach – named after Captain James Cook and famous for its long golden sandy beach. From Cooks Beach you can choose to catch the short ferry ride back to Whitianga and walk to your accommodation – OR - travel back with your driver.

Coromandel Peninsula – Rotorua (B) We take the Pacific Coast Highway through beachside towns of the beautiful Bay of Plenty before turning inland for a bush walk at Okere Falls. Then on to Rotorua, the epicentre not only of New Zealand’s geothermal activity but of Maori heritage. Te Puia is a unique active geothermal site and the nation’s centre for indigenous arts and crafts. It is part of the Maori culture to welcome, guide, entertain, and welcome you like part of the family and you are treated to a private guide throughout your time at Te Puia. Prince’s Gate Hotel, Rotorua – 2 nights

Rotorua (B,D) Today you have the choice of two excursions: a) Visit the Waimangu Volcanic Valley Site of the devastating eruption of Mt. Tarawera in 1886. Explore this ever-changing landscape; walk beside boiling craters and jewel-coloured lakes and take a boat across Lake Rotomahana and hear the story of Guide Sophia. b) Experience the real Middle Earth Visit the Hobbiton Movie Set for a guided tour of The Shire that featured in Peter Jackson's films, The Lord of the Rings trilogy and The Hobbit film series. Your tour includes the Party Tree, a visit to Bag End and you can even have a drink in the Green Dragon! This evening travel to a Marae (Maori Village) to experience a formal welcome (powhiri), a powerful cultural performance, storytelling and Hangi (feasting).

Rotorua to Napier (B,D) Visit the powerful Huka Falls then view the vast Lake Taupo. Across the lake stands the mighty volcanic peaks of Ruapehu, Ngauruhoe and Tongariro. Onto Napier to view one of the world’s most complete examples of Art Deco architecture, second (arguably) only to Miami Beach. This afternoon our local guide brings history and architecture alive with entertaining stories as you discover Napier on foot. Today’s journey has brought us to the North Island’s wine country, so this evening’s treat is dinner at New Zealand’s oldest winery, Mission Estate. Scenic Hotel Te Pania, Napier

Napier to Wellington (B) Travel through the vineyards and orchards of Hawke’s Bay and the bush-clad ranges of the Wairarapa into New Zealand’s capital city, Wellington. On arrival view New Zealand’s magnificent Parliament Buildings including the iconic ‘Beehive’ building. From the Kelburn lookout take the Wellington Cable Car down into the central city precinct before visiting Te Papa – one of the most exciting museums in the world. James Cook Hotel Grand Chancellor, Wellington

Depart Wellington (B) Haere ra – farewell from New Zealand. Today you are transferred to the Wellington Airport for your return home taking with you fond memories of your time in New Zealand. Alternatively, should you wish to extend your stay, we can assist you with additional travel arrangements.

tourName: New Zealand two week holiday, South Island
generalInfo: This tour squeezes more jaw-dropping scenery into two weeks than any other! The South Island has an unparalleled variety of landscapes from the majestic Fox and Franz Josef Glaciers, to the stunning views across Lake Wakatipu, Queenstown, to the Remarkable Mountains.

dayInfo.description: Wellington Haere mai – welcome! Today is yours to explore New Zealand’s friendly capital city; Wellington. A visit to Te Papa, the national museum and one of the most exciting museums in the world, is highly recommended. James Cook Hotel Grand Chancellor, Wellington

Wellington to Nelson (B) Your day commences with one of the most beautiful ferry journeys in the world. Travel to the South Island through the waters of Cook Strait and Queen Charlotte Sound. In Marlborough we enjoy a wine tasting at one of region’s premier wineries. We then cross to sunny Nelson our base for the next two nights. Heritage Rutherford Hotel, Nelson – 2 nights

3 Abel Tasman National Park (B) Abel Tasman National Park is a pristine wilderness of hidden coves and bush-clad ranges best explored by boat and on foot. This morning your tour includes a choice of one of these options: a) 3-4 hour Scenic Cruise (no walking) A morning cruise reveals the golden sands and turquoise waters of Abel Tasman National Park. Enjoy time at leisure in Kaiteriteri and return to Nelson on the late afternoon transfer. b) Walking Option 1: Astrolabe Beaches and Bays (7km, 2.5 hour walk) After the scenic cruise, disembark at Apple Tree Bay for a self-guided walk to fabulous Anchorage Beach. Late afternoon shuttle transfer back to Nelson. c) Walking Option 2: Forest and Swing-Bridge (10.5km, 4 hour walk) After the scenic cruise, disembark at Medlands Beach for a self-guided walk that includes the scenic highlights of the South Head lookout, the famous Falls River swing-bridge and Cleopatra’s Pool. Late afternoon transfer back to Nelson.

Nelson to Punakaiki (B) We drive through the Nelson Lakes National Park to the shores of Lake Rotoiti, then follow the goldminers’ route, crossing the Buller River Gorge by single-track bridges. Emerging from the forest the road hugs the coastline south to the small settlement of Punakaiki - renowned for its wild, rugged coastline and the famous ‘Pancake Rocks. Punakaiki Resort, Punakaiki

5 Punakaiki to Fox Glacier (B) Our route today takes us south along the Great Coast Road through historic towns reaching Hokitika with a chance to browse its excellent art and craft galleries. We continue to Franz Josef and Fox Glaciers. These rivers of ice flow down almost to sea level. Weather permitting, an optional helicopter ride with a snow landing is a terrific way to experience the sheer grandeur of the glaciers (extra cost). Distinction Hotel Fox Glacier

Fox Glacier to Wanaka (B) Have your camera ready for your visit to nearby Lake Matheson for a morning stroll - when conditions are right the lake perfectly mirrors beautiful Mt. Cook in its still waters. Head over the Haast Pass deep into Mt. Aspiring National Park. We reach lovely Lake Wanaka and the pretty resort town of Wanaka. Edgewater Resort, Wanaka – 2 nights

Wanaka (B) This morning you have the choice of two excursions: a) Take a lake cruise to a conservation island Join a local eco-guide to discover rare native birds, island walks and stunning landscape views. b) Experience a scenic 4WD adventure Explore remote High Country farmland. This afternoon is at your leisure to relax or enjoy your own choice of activities.

Wanaka to Te Anau (B) Depart Wanaka with our first stop at the much photographed Cardrona Pub before traversing the Crown Range road to visit historic Arrowtown – a delightful gold rush village. Continue your journey travelling past spectacular Lake Wakatipu to reach Lake Te Anau, gateway to Fiordland National Park. Distinction Hotel Luxmore, Te Anau

Te Anau to Milford Sound to Queenstown (B,L) This morning we follow river gorges through a wilderness of ancient rain forests and spectacular lofty mountains to arrive at Milford Sound. We board a comfortable vessel for a cruise past Mitre Peak to the Tasman Sea. Enjoy a packed lunch and keep an eye peeled for seals and dolphins which are often seen in the waters of the fiord. We end the day in Queenstown. Scenic Suites Queenstown – 2 nights

Queenstown (B) Surrounded by majestic mountains and set on the shores of crystal-clear Lake Wakatipu, the natural beauty and the unique energy of Queenstown create the perfect backdrop for a visit full of adventure, exploration or relaxation. Today is free for you to do your own thing: perhaps a jet-boat ride or a gondola trip up to Bob’s Peak. Boutique wineries and local gardens welcome visitors and the classic steamship TSS Earnslaw is an elegant way to discover Lake Wakatipu (at own cost).

Queenstown to Mt. Cook to Twizel (B) Continue north through the rugged Kawarau Gorge, past pretty Lake Dunstan and across the distinctive Central Otago countryside to the Lindis Pass. Descend into the unique Mackenzie Basin where the Southern Alps dominate the horizon. Take a beautiful drive along Lake Pukaki to Mt. Cook Village, home to New Zealand’s tallest peak, Aoraki/Mt. Cook. We overnight in the rural town of Twizel. Mackenzie Country Hotel, Twizel

Twizel to Rural Canterbury (B,D) Visit a local home set on the shores of Lake Tekapo and learn the secrets of making a Pavlova - a truly Kiwi dessert! Enjoy morning tea and taste your pavlova as you drink in the views of this beautiful lake. View the Church of the Good Shepherd, one of New Zealand’s most-photographed spots: a tiny church set against a majestic backdrop of the Southern Alps. Continue to Ashburton. Accommodation options: a) Rural homestay: Local hosts open their homes to travellers offering a delicious home-cooked dinner before a cosy night’s stay in a family home. b) Local hotel: spend the night in a local hotel enjoying dinner in the hotel restaurant.

13 Ashburton to Christchurch (B,D) We travel across the Canterbury Plains to Christchurch. Relax on the River Avon as you are steered by an Edwardian styled boatman on a flat-bottomed punt through the Botanic Gardens. Then take a trip on a heritage tram through the changing face of this city reinventing itself after the 2010/11 earthquakes. Tonight we enjoy a relaxed farewell dinner at a local restaurant. Distinction Hotel, Christchurch

Depart Christchurch (B) Haere ra – farewell from New Zealand. You are transferred to the Christchurch Airport for your return home taking with you fond memories of your time in New Zealand. Alternatively, should you wish to extend your stay, we can assist you with additional travel arrangements.

tourName: North Island self drive tour in New Zealand
generalInfo: This 8-day circular tour starts in Auckland and finishes in Auckland. Explore the Central North Island's jewels. Starting in Auckland visit the famous Waitomo Caves, Rotorua's culture and geothermal attractions and the wonderful golden beaches of the Coromandel and the Bay of Plenty.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Auckland! Meet your private driver who will give you an information pack including maps and driving instructions, then take you to your hotel.
Collect your car then head south to the Waitomo Glow Worm Caves. Explore a 30-million-year-old limestone cave network travelling deep underground to see stalactites and stalagmites.
Today cross the lush farmland of the Waikato as you make your way inland to Rotorua. Pass through several small farming towns, before arriving to Rotorua, the geothermal region of the north island.

Your day in Rotorua could be spent immersed in culture or sampling the many adventures to be had. In the evening visit Mitai Maori Village, to give you an awe-inspiring introduction to the indigenous Maori culture.
Travel along the scenic route of the Bay of Plenty before reaching the idyllic Coromandel Peninsula where you will stay for the next 2 nights.

Spend the day relaxing at one of the many white sandy beaches or exploring the inland forests. We recommend taking a boat trip to explore the volcanic coastline with its many caves, blowholes and golden beaches.

Cross the Coromandel Ranges descending down to the Firth of Thames where there is an out of way spot to see wading shorebirds on the coastline. Then travel across the Hauraki Plains to Auckland for your last night in New Zealand.

Explore more of vibrant Auckland city, known as 'City of Sails,' before dropping your rental car at the airport and flying home. Alternatively continue your holiday in New Zealand and see the South Island with one of our many tours...

tourName: North to South Island self drive holiday, New Zealand
generalInfo:
Embark on an unforgettable adventure with our self-drive tour in New Zealand. Navigate breathtaking landscapes at your own pace, from the majestic mountains to the pristine coastlines. Experience the freedom of the open road and create lasting memories on your personalized self-drive journey.

From top to toe; on the North Island, explore the cities of Auckland, the tropical Bay of Islands, Rotorua and Wellington before embarking on a circuit of the South Island. The wine regions of Marlborough, the whales of Kaikoura, the garden city of Christchurch and the mighty Southern Alps. The Alpine adventure town of Queenstown awaits before heading to the West Coast Glaciers. Return to Christchurch on board the world famous TranzAlpine Scenic train.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Auckland the 'City of Sails.' You will be met on arrival and taken to your city hotel.
Collect your rental car, then it's over the harbour bridge and north to the tropical Bay of Islands.
A full day to explore, you could take to the water or discover the history of Waitangi.
Cross Northland following the aqua blue waters of the Hokianga before travelling down the Kauri Coast.
Drive south through the fertile farmland of the Waikato and maybe stop at Hobbiton Village on your way to Rotorua.
Your day in Rotorua could be spent discovering Maori culture or thrilling adventure rides.
Today is filled with fantastic scenery including Lake Taupo, the Desert Road and the Kapiti Coastline as you approach Wellington.
Today you'll cross the Cook Strait by Ferry. Approaching Picton you'll cruise through the spectacular Marlborough Sounds.
Drive to the seaside town of Kaikoura today.
It’s just a short drive south to Christchurch, if time allows perhaps stop at the Waipara Valley wineries.
Explore the ever-changing city of Christchurch.
Today you'll enjoy a scenic drive through Canterbury and the MacKenzie Country.
Follow the dry lands to Lindis Pass which leads into Central Otago, then through the Kawerau Gorge to Queenstown.
The day is yours to discover all the scenic spots and fun activities on offer in Queenstown.
Take the Crown Range Road to Wanaka before travelling the spectacular Haast Pass to the West Coast.
Explore Franz Josef and Westland National Park.
Drive north along the stunning West Coast Road and take the TranzAlpine train to Christchurch.
Depart Christchurch today.

tourName: South Island self drive tour in New Zealand
generalInfo:
This 10-day tour gives you the freedom to explore the breath-taking natural wonders of the South Island in the comfort of your own hire car. Starting and finishing in Christchurch, this circular route takes you to the icons of the South Island, including the Fiordland National Park and Mildord Sounds at the very tip of the island, as well as the snow-capped volcanic mountain ranges of Mt Cook National Park. With extra nights in Christchurch and Queenstown you'll have time to discover the cool and vibrant city life of New Zealand.

You begin with a journey past the mountains of the Southern Alps and turquoise waters of alpine lakes before arriving into Mt. Cook National Park. Next you venture further south to Te Anau, gateway to Fiordland National Park. Here you’ll explore the pristine wilderness on a Milford Sound nature cruise. In Queenstown, the Adventure Capital, there’s time to enjoy the scenery and endless activities on offer before returning to Christchurch via the magnificent West Coast Glaciers.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Christchurch City! On arrival you will be given an information pack including maps and driving instructions, before your private driver takes you to your hotel.

Collect your car this morning, then the day is yours to explore Christchurch or maybe a day trip to Akaroa. You can drive an hour in any direction to ski, mountain bike, wine taste, whale-watch, bungy jump or play golf!

Today you'll enjoy a scenic drive through Canterbury and the MacKenzie Country you'll enjoy a scenic drive through the heart of the South Island, crossing the vast Canterbury plains and the MacKenzie Country. Driving time for this leg is approximately 4 hours. Stop at the picturesque lakeside town of Tekapo, then follow the road and take in the view of Aoraki Mt Cook (New Zealand's tallest mountain) from the shores of Lake Pukaki.

Drive to Twizel, just south of Aoraki/Mt. Cook and the location of many Lord of the Rings movie scenes. Then drive the Lindis and through the Kawerau Gorge to Queenstown and south to Te Anau, the gateway to Fiordland National Park and Milford Sound. We recommend going on the Te Anau Glowworm cave tour with a scenic cruise across Lake Te Anau.

Journey along the road to Milford Sound with some of the most beautiful and iconic scenery in the country. From crystal clear lakes and towering mountains to lush glacier formed meadows, this area is dramatic and unyielding.
Travel through rolling Southland countryside then follow Lake Wakatipu where the mountain range towers over your approach into the adventure capital of New Zealand, Queenstown.

The day is yours to discover all the scenic spots and fun adrenaline activities on offer in Queenstown. Take a leisurely lakeside stroll or ride the gondola for breath-taking views, or head down the Gibbston Valley wine trail to sample some of the region’s best Pinot.

Take the Crown Range Road to Wanaka, the gateway to Mt Aspiring National Park and stunning Lake Wanaka, before travelling the spectacular Haast Pass to the West Coast. Allow time for photo stops along the way!

Drive north along the stunning West Coast Road to Greystone, approximately 2 hours. Drop your rental car off and board one of the world's great train journeys, the TranzAlpine Scenic Train to Christchurch. From the comfort of your carriage see lush beech forest, deep river valleys and the spectacular peaks of the Southern Alps.
Depart Christchurch today with a transfer to the airport. Alternatively continue your vacation in New Zealand and see the North Island with one of our many tours...

tourName: Swim with whales in the South Pacific
generalInfo:
Discover Niue – An Intimate Whale Swimming Adventure Like No Other

Imagine floating in the warm, crystal-clear waters of the South Pacific, face to face with a gentle giant. In Niue, one of the smallest nations in the world, you can experience one of nature’s most humbling encounters—swimming alongside humpback whales in their natural habitat.

Our small-group tours offer an exclusive, crowd-free whale experience—there are no big boats, no jostling for space—just you, the whales, and the vast blue ocean. Niue’s unique underwater visibility, often exceeding 50 metres, makes it one of the clearest places on Earth to see these majestic creatures.

What makes it special?

World-class whale interactions – Niue is one of the few places where you can legally swim with humpback whales. With only 6 people in the water at any one time!

Pristine waters and dramatic coastline – Swim in hidden sea caves, snorkel vibrant coral reefs, and explore chasms carved by centuries of ocean swells.
Unspoiled island life – With no traffic lights, minimal tourism, and a warm Polynesian welcome, Niue feels like stepping back in time.

Adventure and culture combined – Beyond the whales, discover local markets, traditional weaving, tropical forests, and the island’s fascinating limestone geology.

Eco-conscious travel – Our tours operate with deep respect for wildlife and local traditions, ensuring encounters are ethical and sustainable.

Your days are filled with ocean adventures, nature walks, and cultural immersion. Evenings bring breathtaking sunsets, star-filled skies, and the gentle sound of waves against the reef.

This isn’t just a holiday—it’s a once-in-a-lifetime connection with the wild, the ocean, and yourself.

dayInfo.description: Day 1 – Arrival in Niue: Arrive on the island and transfer to your accommodation at Scenic Matavai Resort Niue. Welcome drink and dinner while soaking in ocean views. Settle in and enjoy a relaxing evening under the stars.

Day 2 – First Whale Swimming & Island Orientation. Tropical breakfast overlooking the sea. Morning briefing before heading out for your first guided whale swimming experience with licensed local operators. Afternoon at leisure—explore the resort pool, snorkel from shore, or take a gentle coastal walk. Dinner at a local restaurant.

Day 3 – Whale Swimming & Sea Caves Exploration. Whale swimming experience (trip two of five) in crystal-clear waters, with visibility often exceeding 50 metres. Afternoon guided visit to some of Niue’s most spectacular sea caves and coastal formations. Sunset drinks and dinner at the resort.

Day 4 – Cultural Immersion & Dolphin Encounters. Morning whale swimming (trip three) – keep an eye out for playful spinner dolphins. Afternoon cultural activity: learn the art of traditional Niuean basket weaving. Visit the Taoga Niue Museum to discover the island’s rich history and heritage. Dinner at a lcoal restaurant.

Day 5 – Whale Swimming & Guided Snorkelling Tour. Morning whale swimming (trip four). Afternoon guided snorkelling adventure exploring the marine life. Evening free for stargazing or enjoying a quiet drink on your balcony before dinner at a nearby restaurant.

Day 6 – Final Whale Swimming & Nature Walk. Last whale swimming (trip five), cherishing your final moments with these magnificent giants. Afternoon guided hike along Niue’s dramatic coastline, discovering hidden chasms and rainforest trails. Dinner at a nearby restaurant.

Day 7 – Leisure & Optional Activities. Enjoy a slow morning with breakfast by the ocean. Choose from optional activities: cycling the island, visiting local markets, or another snorkelling session. Afternoon at leisure—perfect for a swim, exploring or simply relaxing by the infinity pool. Farewell at dinner at the resort.
Day 8 – Departure Breakfast and final ocean views. Transfer to Niue International Airport for your return flight.

tourName: Tailor made tour of New Zealand
placesVisited: Auckland, Paihia, Bay of Islands, Rotorua, Te Puia, Taupo, Napier, Wellington, Nelson, Abel Tasman Coastal Track, Christchurch, TranzAlpine through the Southern Alps, Hokitika, Fox Glacier, Wanaka, Te Anau, Fiordland National Park, Milford Sound, Queenstown, Mount Cook National Park
generalInfo:
This self-drive tailor made tour of New Zealand takes you from the North Island to the South Island, taking in all the country’s best-known highlights as well as little-visited, out of the way sights. Over 27 days you’ll get to know the ‘real’ New Zealand with the help of local guides and small, authentic hotels and lodges.

Your North Island highlights will include swimming with dolphins at the Bay of Islands, staying on a farm in Waikato, wine tasting in the winelands of Hawkes Bay and watching Maori craftsmen at Te Puia.

South Island brings more natural and cultural highlights, among which are walking part of the Abel Tasman Coastal Track, whizzing past stunning scenery on the TranzAlpine train from Christchurch to Greymouth, and planting a tree at a reforestation project at Wanaka’s Mou Waho Island.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Auckland International Airport where you will be welcomed to New Zealand and transferred by private car to your hotel, which is located in the heart of the city, placing you within walking distance of a variety of the city’s dining, shopping and entertainment venues. Remainder of the day at leisure to explore the ‘City of Sails’.

Start the day with a leisurely breakfast before taking a ferry out to the pretty seaside town of Devonport with its beautiful views and fabulous cafes. Or head out to Rangitoto Island and walk up to the summit for amazing 360° views of the Hauraki Maritime Gulf or visit the conservation island of Tiritiri Matangi to see endemic species such as the Takahe and the Kokako.
Collect your rental car and drive north over the Auckland Harbour Bridge, along the Hibiscus Coast Highway to the seaside town of Paihia in the beautiful Bay of Islands.

After a lovely breakfast at your accommodation enjoy a stroll in Paihia and in the afternoon board a cruise to the ‘hole in the rock’ , or take a ferry over to the historic village of Russell once called 'The Hellhole of the Pacific'.

After breakfast join a guided tour of the Waitangi Treaty House and grounds – it was here in 1840 that the historic document was signed between Maori chiefs and British settlers forming the nation of New Zealand. Enter the meeting house, be awestruck at the size of the war canoe or stroll across the lawns for views out over the sea.

Time to leave the Bay of Islands and head South to Rotorua. En route it is possible to experience the real Middle Earth and visit Hobbiton Take a look at Bag End, where Frodo and Bilbo’s adventures began. Get lost among the hobbit holes and visit the Green Dragon Inn, the mill and the Party Tree. Listen to spell-binding tales of how Hobbiton came to be.

Visit the popular attraction of Te Puia to see Maori craftsmen demonstrating weaving, carving and other traditional skills and explore the fascinating geothermal wonderland. This evening experience Maori culture with a traditional ceremony, cultural performances and hangi meal.
Following breakfast, time to head to Taupo, the vast lake formed by a super-volcano thousands of years ago. This is a good spot for lunch before continuing to Hawkes Bay.

After breakfast spend the day exploring Napier, the Art Deco capital of New Zealand. Take a guided walking tour to learn about how the town was rebuilt following the devastating earthquake in 1930. In the afternoon, take a wine tour guided by a local expert and visit some of the many boutique wineries for which the area is famous.

Travel south through the farmlands of central Hawke’s Bay and the Wairarapa into Wellington, the capital city and Seat of Parliament. Walk down Cuba Street with its eclectic mix of cafes, boutiques and bars, or spend the afternoon immersing yourself in New Zealand culture and history in Te Papa, the outstanding National Museum.
Board the Interislander ferry for a three and a half hour cruise to Picton. Drive to Nelson, the sunniest region in New Zealand famed for its easy lifestyle and vibrant arts scene.

The best way to appreciate the amazing beaches is by boat, so after a coach transfer, hop on a small cruiser for the day. Land on an idyllic beach and walk a section of the famous Abel Tasman Coastal Track, then re-join the boat at Torrent Bay. Return to Nelson.

Depart by coach and enjoy the drive via the Lewis Pass or Blenheim for an East Coast journey to Christchurch. You can of course, choose to drive this and you would be able to stop off in Kaikoura on the way to Christchurch and enjoy a whale watching trip.

Depart Christchurch on the TranzAlpine train for a scenic rail journey through the splendour of the Southern Alps to the West Coast. Enjoy thrilling vistas over deep gorges as you travel alongside the ice-fed Waimakariri River to Arthur’s Pass before continuing on to the town of Greymouth. Collect your rental car and drive down the West Coast to the town of Hokitika, famed for its gold mining heritage.

After breakfast continue south through the native rainforest of the Southern Alps Mountain Range to the small township of Fox Glacier. Take a walk to the Glacier and around the beautiful Lake Matheson. Or take to the sky and enjoy a scenic flight to see the glacier close up.

Today travel south through the ever-changing scenery of the Haast Pass across the Southern Alps and around the shores of l Lake Hawea and into the charming town of Wanaka in Mt Aspiring National Park. Spend the afternoon exploring the town’s galleries, cafes and craft studios or take a walk around the shores of the lake and dine at one of the many highly rated restaurants.

A day at leisure - Take a short drive out to the Matukituki Valley to view the Rob Roy Glacier, or enjoy an exhilarating river cruise on Lake Wanaka Alternatively visit the magical Mou Waho Island nature reserve, where guide Chris Riley will introduce you to the unique landscapes and diverse flora and fauna of the island.
A day at leisure to enjoy all that Wanaka offers. Enjoy a slow walk along the lake and then maybe have some lunch in Wanaka.

Today travel across Central Otago, around the shores of Lake Wakatipu and across Southland to Te Anau, gateway to the Fiordland National Park. Enjoy a short walk around the lake or cruise to the western shores of Lake Te Anau and visit the Glow worm caves.

Travel by coach from Te Anau into Fiordland National Park to Milford Sound. Stop at the Mirror Lakes to see the near perfect reflections of the mountains, before arriving in Milford Sound. Cruise the Sound past Mitre Peak to the Tasman Sea. Enjoy the stunning scenery of cascading waterfalls, dense rainforest and the marine life that inhabits these waters.

Surrounded by majestic mountains and set on the shores of crystal clear Lake Wakatipu, the natural beauty and unique energy of the Queenstown region create the perfect backdrop for a holiday full of adventure, exploration or relaxation.

As well as white-knuckle thrills, Queenstown offers gentle cycling, wine-tasting, a gondola ride and good shopping. A cruise on TSS Earnslaw up to Walter Peak sheep station for dinner is a favourite early evening option.
Drive alongside the shores of Lake Pukaki into Mount Cook National Park. This is an International Dark Sky Reserve and at the Mount John Observatory you can see galaxies ‘far far away’.
Sir Edmund Hillary climbed these peaks before his ascent of Everest. Visit the Alpine Centre that bears his name, before following the Hooker Valley Track for superb views of Mount Cook.

After enjoying the view from the Church of the Good Shepherd, step aside to see the statue which celebrates the working sheepdogs of the Mackenzie area, then cross the Canterbury Plains to Christchurch.

Following the 2011 earthquake, the 'Garden City' is rebuilding, blending old and new to reclaim its place as the premier city of the South Island. A guided tour with a local is a must, then try a tram ride or go punting.
After breakfast transfer to Christchurch Airport to return your rental vehicle and board your flight home.

tourName: 12 Day Best of New Zealand Tour
placesVisited: Auckland, Rotorua, Napier, Martinborough, Wellington, Blenheim, Christchurch, Â Aoraki/Mount Cook, Queenstown, Milford Sound, Waitomo
generalInfo: You don’t have to ask for the best to know that the best is what you’re getting. The silence of Milford Sound surrounds you. The vista of the Panorama Restaurant stretches before you. The steam from the crater on White Island rises into the sky. From the Art Deco architecture of Napier to the extraordinary culture of Rotorua, New Zealand is filled with the unique, the diverse, and nothing less than the exceptional. This is New Zealand at its best and it never settles for less.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Welcome to the Best
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Auckland and settle into the largest city in New Zealand. The arch of the Harbour Bridge glistens in the sunlight. The skyscrapers stand tall over the city, including the Sky Tower , the Southern Hemisphere’s tallest freestanding structure. Boats wade in the harbor and rock to the gentle sway of the sea. Walk along the vibrant life of Queens Street, the urban heart of the city. The shops bustle with life, from the charming boutiques to the high-end fashion. The lingering scent of cafes surrounds you, from the rich scent of fresh-brewed coffee, to the sweet perfume of fresh bread. Open your eyes to Auckland’s diverse and stunning offerings, from the food to the people, and you will begin to see the tip of the iceberg of New Zealand’s best.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - The Best Glow
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart from Auckland and watch the skyline fade into the horizon as you make your way to the famous Waitomo Caves . Follow your guide through the limestone maze. The air is cool around you. Touch the cave walls and feel the smooth, slick surface. You can hear the sound of trickling water before you are guided onto a small boat. Drift through the cave’s waterway, the ceiling undulating and at times seemingly dripping the limestone down to touch the water. The black darkness gives way to speckles of shimmering blue that cling to the walls, ceiling, and stalactites. As you get closer the blue becomes brighter, strewn through the cave like fairy lights. You have arrived at the famous Glowworm Grotto where the luminescence of the glowworms lights the cave in iridescent blue. As you continue to drift through the cave the light from the glowworms fade, the cave entrance opens, and you continue your journey to Rotorua. Arrive in Rotorua, known to be the Cultural Capital of New Zealand. The diverse mixture of traditional Maori culture convenes together with the influences of European culture and history. The city was built upon the geothermal wonders of the province, giving the architecture a quaint Victorian charm with the luxuries of resort decadence. In the evening you will experience the cultural vivacity of the Maori with a visit to a Hangi , a traditional feast, complete with concert.
