A local guide will accompany you on your journey and lead you to the highlights of this tropical Pacific island. Vineyards cover the hills, which are idyllic places to taste experimental wines and feel yourself unwind. Small bays and beaches also cover the island, and these always make for easy afternoons. Tiny villages often demonstrate Waiheke’s alternative culture, and a series of sculptures line the western cliffs, showcasing indigenous art and style. Waiheke is excellent as a day trip. The ferries run regularly all day, so you can take the day as it comes and discover the area with your local guide.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua – Evening With the Maori
dayInfo.description: Today marks the first of three sublime journeys that you will have in different parts of New Zealand. This part of the North Island is marked by conical hills, green pastures, and volcanic plains. It is about 2 hours to Rotorua, and you will travel via Waitomo. Glowworms will illuminate magnificent limestone formations, and there will be a real sense of the surreal as you drift through the caves in a boat. The afternoon will be at your leisure in Rotorua before an evening tour of a geothermal park. Here, there are geysers, mud pools, and the highlight of being welcomed by a Maori community. This will be a dramatic and somewhat frightening experience because you will witness warriors in full costume. From there, it will be all smiles with an evening of dance, song, sharing stories, and learning the Maori ways.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua – Volcanic Hot Springs
dayInfo.description: Steam escapes from cracks in the asphalt roads of Rotorua, geothermal activity bubbles everywhere, and you will visit a second thermal park this morning. Here, geysers shoot 30 feet into the air, and pools of mud take a bizarre color. This will be a relaxed day, and, following the park, you will be taken across a lake in a traditional canoe to an island of volcanic hot springs that is perfect for resting both your body and mind. Maori locals will be your guides, so today will bring a further understanding of their culture and ways.

dayInfo.title: Wellington – Middle-earth’s Volcanoes
dayInfo.description: New Zealand has fabulous landscapes, and transfers between destinations are not simply transfers but beautiful travel experiences. Today, you can sit back and watch Middle-earth unfold from a first-class train carriage. Cutting past most of North Island’s main volcanoes, the railway follows a rural and winding route from Taupo near Rotorua to the coast and capital city of Wellington. You do not need to move because the scenery will change dramatically as you twist between majestic peaks, gaze up at volcanic craters, and slowly roll into the low-key waterside city of Wellington.

dayInfo.title: Wellington – The World’s Cutest Capital City
dayInfo.description: With its colorful streets and laid-back ways, Wellington feels nothing like a capital. This is one of the reasons that it is so agreeable. You will spend the day with a local guide, exploring Wellington at a slow pace and stopping to discover the city’s fine cafes. There are many directions that you can travel, and most of the best will lead you to different neighborhoods, where there are boutiques galore and the slow pace that you may have come to expect from a village. Many travelers miss Wellington, but it is a superb destination, especially for senior travelers.

dayInfo.title: Blenheim – Dolphins and Scenic Splendor
dayInfo.description: Today will present the last part of your journey trilogy. After the road through the north and train into Middle-earth, you will cruise across Marlborough Sounds on a boat, connecting Wellington with Blenheim on the South Island. Dolphins almost always mark this route, and you will travel between astonishing green cliffs and islands that are small in size but tall in shape. When you arrive, you will disembark on the South Island, and a local guide will lead you to Blenheim, which is another laid-back New Zealand town where the focus is on fine tastes and experience. This is wine country, and the afternoon and evening will provide you with stunning gastronomic experiences led by your local guide.

dayInfo.title: Blenheim – New Zealand’s Finest Wine Region
dayInfo.description: Famous for its crisp Sauvignon Blanc, Marlborough is the darling of New Zealand wine regions. Over the last ten years, it has turned from boutique gem to international wonder, although there are still plenty of small producers to rival the more famous exporters. Aromas of freshly cut grass and apples dominate the nose when tasting the Sauvignon Blanc, and there are other soft and subtle varietals to try. Blenheim’s food is reflective of the wine, and your guide will know an excellent low-key vineyard for a leisurely lunch. As with most days on your 12-day New Zealand tour, today can be entirely tailored to your interests.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Mountains and Lakeside Bliss
dayInfo.description: After flying south to Queenstown, the landscape will change dramatically. Lovely plains will be replaced by towering mountains and a strong sense of wilderness. Lake Wakatipu stretches out from beneath your lodge, and the Remarkables reflect perfectly on the water. A local guide will provide you with a brief orientation tour, so you will know the best places to dine. Queenstown is really small and quiet in addition to being a very walkable city. Here, nature is always dominant wherever you are. Today will be at your leisure, and your lodge has an excellent Polynesian spa in which you can indulge. For the perfect Queenstown introduction, you should consider taking a cable car to Bob’s Peak, which is especially gorgeous at sunset.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – The Wonders of Fiordland
dayInfo.description: Fiordland National Park is roughly the size of Connecticut, and it is just one part of a UNESCO World Heritage wilderness that covers almost half of the South Island. Much of Fiordland remains unexplored and inaccessible, except for those who can travel by helicopter. On a private helicopter tour, you will soar over glaciers and ridges. Eventually, you will touch down on a glacier to wander across the ice. You can also touch down on a mountain, where extravagant vistas can be complemented by a picnic and plenty of stories from your pilot. With a full day flight, you can gasp at the area’s changing scenery and begin to understand the scale of this untamed and unchanged land.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Laid-Back Discovery
dayInfo.description: This final day will be left free and is completely customizable to your interests. You can indulge in a 4WD tour to Glenorchy and Lord of the Rings filming locations. Moreover, you can indulge in a trip to the mountains and one of the excellent easy hiking trails. There will also be a spa along with a beautiful lakeside trail. Plus, you can even partake in some adventures on the water, including a jetboat ride or an old-world steamer that traverses Lake Wakatipu. Whatever you do will be all up to you, and there is so much you can try.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Departure
dayInfo.description: After another leisurely morning and breakfast, you will be transferred to Queenstown’s international airport.

tourName: Inspiring Self Drive New Zealand Vacation
placesVisited: Auckland, Coromandel Peninsula & th, Rotorua, Queenstown, Aoraki / Mt. Cook Nationa, Christchurch
generalInfo: Fourteen days will allow you to discover the many wonders of New Zealand on this adventurous, handcrafted tour leading from the dazzling cosmopolitan of Auckland to the garden city of Christchurch. Along the way, New Zealand’s staggering wilderness will come to life as you explore the mesmerizing plains, gleaming peninsulas, and alpine peaks that sweep New Zealand’s illustrious countryside.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Something for Everyone
dayInfo.description: Auckland is a thriving cosmopolitan city that is both a beating economic heart of New Zealand and a gateway to the spectacular unspoiled scenery that spreads through the North Island’s countryside. For those seeking city highlights or a little more adventure, you will be thrilled to find something for everyone in Auckland, from the pristine parks peppering its charming districts to the decadent restaurants lining its beautiful boulevards. After transferring to your accommodation, you will have the evening to acclimate to the atmospheric city of Auckland.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Into the Wild
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will join a guide for an eco-tour of Auckland’s breathtaking surroundings. Starting at the Waitakere Ranges, you will absorb the history shrouding the forested region from viewpoints overlooking the viridian expanse and sites hosting age-old Maori carvings. The details of the rainforest will come to life as you stroll along shaded paths to the soundtrack of the birds singing before continuing to a hideaway west coast beach flanked by the flourishing vegetation and cascading waterfalls of the rainforest.

dayInfo.title: Coromandel Peninsula - Across the Pohutukawa Coast
dayInfo.description: You will collect your rental car and begin your self-driving vacation after breakfast, where you will make tracks for the Coromandel Peninsula. You will cruise slowly past the rolling green plains of Hauraki towards the Thames Estuary wildlife sanctuary, where bird and plant life flourish with one another. The drive passing these scenes, along the Pohutukawa Coast, will be spellbinding and provide ample photo-worthy moments to commemorate your crossing. You will soon arrive at your charming secluded resort tucked away on the Coromandel Peninsula.

dayInfo.title: Coromandel Peninsula - Balmy Waters of Hot Water Beach
dayInfo.description: Today, you may submerge yourself in the cultural and wildlife highlights that compose the beauty of the Coromandel Peninsula. After breakfast, retreat to the quaint town of Tairua, a seaside destination and fishing village fringed by a volcanic hill that boasts sandy beaches to set your feet upon and fresh waters to enjoy a vitalizing dip. Following your strolls through town, you will make your way to the famous Hot Water Beach, a geothermally heated shore featuring balmy waters to soak in while basking in the golden sunshine.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - Landscapes of the Lord of the Rings
dayInfo.description: After enjoying breakfast, you will pack your belongings and jump in the car to begin your next adventure. Your travels will lead you to Wahi, where you may catch a glimpse of the spectacular scenes from a soaring vantage point overlooking the Martha Mine or from the windows of the historical significant Goldfields Railway. Following these bewitching spectacles, you will witness the landscapes featured in the Lord of the Rings films and visit the magical fields where the Hobbits resided, known as the Hobbiton, before reaching your final destination, Rotorua.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - Stories of the Maori People
dayInfo.description: Rotorua is yours to explore this morning, and you will be thrilled to discover several geothermal wonders during your day touring its surroundings. From the colorful geological formations composing the Wai-O-Tapu Thermal Wonderland to the sparkling lake vistas and geysers sweeping the landscape, Rotorua will delight and dazzle you. In the evening, you will delve deeper into traditional Maori culture as you enjoy an authentic dinner in the Mitai Maori Village, accompanied by a colorful local performance. Stories of the Maori people and their customs will fill the evening as you spend it alongside these welcoming hosts.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - New Zealand’s Adventure Capital
dayInfo.description: You will drop your rental car off this morning and make your way to the Rotorua airport to catch a flight bound for the adventure capital of New Zealand, Queenstown. Queenstown is poised on the banks of Lake Wakatipu, and there are many marvelous ways to witness its unending natural beauty during your stay here. For today, you may settle in at your accommodation and appreciate the spirited atmosphere that sweeps the city’s endearing districts before tucking into an assortment of deliciously cooked seafood dishes set to dazzle your taste buds.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Dining on Lake Wakatipu
dayInfo.description: Queenstown is packed with activities to keep both adventure enthusiasts and history buffs enthused. Depending on your preferences, you may wish to marvel at the picturesque scenery of the Fiordland National Park or tour the Gibbston Valley, home to a collection of prestigious wines produced by the region’s bountiful vineyards. Either way, you will be thrilled to discover Queenstown before you transfer to the TSS Earnslaw Steamship for an evening cruise and country farm BBQ dining experience served under the twinkling stars.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Wonders of the Te Wahipounamu World Heritage Area
dayInfo.description: Today is the day to relish the lakeside scenery as you zip across the water onboard a jet boat that will skim through the canyons and past the craggy cliffs to the Te Wahipounamu World Heritage Area. Your guide for the day will share information on the surrounding area as you revel in images of the colorful birds fleeting through the forest and backdrops of the dramatic landscape that circles you. You will also delve into the history of the destination, uncovering what made the Dart River a pivotal part of early Maori trade.

dayInfo.title: Aoraki - Making Way for Mount Cook
dayInfo.description: Today, you will embark for the alpine summits of Mount Cook after breakfast, once you have gathered your belongings and checked out of your accommodation. Driving from Queenstown, you will pass the cascading green vineyards of the Gibbston Valley before reaching the fruit orchards of Cromwell and continuing over the bewitching Lindis Pass. Scenes of golden tussocks and towering peaks will welcome you to the mountainous countryside of New Zealand as you draw closer and closer to the crest of Mount Cook.

dayInfo.title: Aoraki - Glacial Geological Discoveries
dayInfo.description: Mount Cook is a remarkable glacial summit you will be delighted to discover today as you are joined by a guide and ascend to its peak, where the snow and ice have fortified the rocky cliffs. From forested lakes and rivers to mighty ice cliffs and bobbing icebergs, Mount Cook is an alpine playground you will swoon over as you step one foot in front of the other in the snow. You will also explore the local village as you grow ever fonder of the rural and modest lifestyle adopted by the people who reside beneath this difficult terrain.

dayInfo.title: Christchurch - Glimmers of Gold in the Canterbury Plains
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will pack your bags and check out of your accommodation in preparation for the next leg and final destination of your New Zealand vacation, Christchurch. Your journey there will lead you across the countryside. First, you will pass the turquoise waters of Lake Pukaki and the charming little town of Tekapo before cruising across the gorgeous farmlands of Burkes Pass until finally capturing the simplistic majesty of the ever-golden and endlessly stretching Canterbury Plains. These glorious scenes mark the final stretch before you arrive in Christchurch.

dayInfo.title: Christchurch - Romantic Moments with Nature
dayInfo.description: You will have a full day to lose yourselves in the picture-perfect restored garden city of Christchurch, a remarkable feat of city design that uplifted itself after the events of a tragic natural disaster. The districts work with the environment in one cohesive human and nature combination perfectly embodied by highlights such as the Christchurch Botanic Gardens. You may wander the impressive landscaped park boasting fragrant flower fields and pristine lawns before gliding across the Avon River by gondola and enjoying a romantic dinner before bed.

dayInfo.title: Christchurch - Celebrating the Adventure
dayInfo.description: Today, although the last day of your New Zealand vacation, will be nothing short of perfection as you wake up to the morning sunshine peering in between your blinds. The subtle smell of freshly brewed coffee will invite you to the dining room where you will savor your last meal in the magical country before strolling the exuberant neighborhood one last time. Capture images and locate trinkets to celebrate your adventures here. Afterward, you will be collected and whisked away to the airport where you will depart the islands of New Zealand.

tourName: Lord of the Rings New Zealand Tour Package
placesVisited: Auckland, Rotorua, Wellington, Queenstown
generalInfo: Your 13-day New Zealand Tour has you explore the culture and landscape in a way only Tolkien could have imagined and Peter Jackson could have captured, on this ultimate Lord of the Rings adventure. Lush hills roll over hobbit-holes. The all-seeing Eye of Mordor burns in the distance, magma bubbling below. Welcome to Middle Earth, where the majesty of the Lord of the Rings films come alive.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Welcome to Middle Earth
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Auckland, New Zealand and say hello to the borders of Middle Earth. The beauty of New Zealand casts spells over visitors and locals alike, written in the mountains, stored in the water, and seen in the sky. The “City of Sails,” is New Zealand’s largest city where sails float over the water like clouds adding to the majesty of an already captivating country. Settle into the outskirts of Middle Earth and prepare yourself for the adventurous journey to come, where there is more to desire than just “the one ring.” Today you will take the ferry and cross a small sliver of ocean heading to Waihike Island. Explore the island on a guided tour, experiencing the diverse beauty of Waiheke. The cool breeze blows across-shore and through the trees. The smell of vineyards drifts along the hills. The sun is warm and inviting in the sky. Traverse the Awaawaroa Trig Hill Track and enter a quiet valley hidden in the shadows of the island’s highest mountain. The smell of the sea merges with the unique flowers that bloom along the walkway. On the Awaawaroa Bay Lookout you can see the hills roll out onto the water. The water is a clear blue in the sunlight. The landscape is lush, shining various shades of green. As the sun begins to set over the ocean and the deep red glows along the shore, you know you are becoming a part of Tolkien’s world.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - Enter the Shire
dayInfo.description: Today you will depart Auckland and make your way to Hobbiton, a private farm home to the Shire. Rebuilt and used for The Hobbit trilogy as well, walking into Hobbiton is more than just visiting the Shire; it is walking directly into Tolkien’s imagination. Hobbit-holes are carved into the lush hills, their wooden frames blend organically into the landscape, the circular doors colorfully and centrally placed. The air is perfumed with sweet, fresh grass and newly-blossomed flowers. The double-arched bridge glides over the water. The Green Dragon Inn stands elegantly, its interior emitting freshly poured ale and lacquered wood. The green dragon adorns the bar, swirling around the façade with a slight smile. Linger amongst Tolkien’s world come to life before departing for Waitomo Caves. The Waitomo Caves are natural caves that plunge deep into the King Country region. The air is damp. The sound of trickling water echoes along the walls. You drift along the river expecting to see Gollum climbing along the cavern’s edge, but you see a collection of lights in the distance. Glowworms speckle the cave giving the grotto twinkles of blue radiance in the darkness. Draped along the cave’s walls and ceiling, the glowworms add a galaxy of light to the darkness of the cave. The Waitomo Caves are like something out of Tolkien’s imagination or Peter Jackson’s cinematography, but carved into the earth these caves take you beyond the creative realm of The Lord of the Rings and into the breathtaking eccentricity of reality. Once you exit Waitomo you will continue on to Rotorua where your luxurious accommodation awaits.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - Journey Through the Valleys
dayInfo.description: Begin your day by venturing out into the incredible sites of Rotorua that will bring you deeper into Middle Earth on your way to Mordor. Tour the incredible thermal wonderland of Waiotapu. The Champagne Pool, known for its abundant outward flow of carbon dioxide, has a craggy, briny surrounding that gives way to a cracked, orange shore that reaches the smoldering green water. The simmering sound of geysers fills the area. From the smoldering Champagne Pool of Waiotapu to the steaming landscape of the Waimangu Volcanic Valley, the sweltering landscape puts you in the shoes of Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee as they made their way to the All-seeing Eye. Waimangue Volcanic Valley is the youngest geothermal system in the world and has pools of sapphire blue that emit heavy steam. Part of the valley is still scarred from the volcano’s eruption, a sulfuric white and charred orange that drapes across part of the open mountain range. Follow Frodo’s footsteps through the redwood forest, the scent of rough bark emanating from the trees before you encounter the different cultures that have made New Zealand so diverse. Rotorua is known to be New Zealand’s cultural capital mixing the rich history of Maori and European settlers in one area. Tonight you will learn about the incredible perseverance and continuing cultural connections of the Maori in the Rotorua area. Enter the Marae , the traditional Maori meetinghouse, and be greeted with a hongi , a pressing of your nose to another’s, a sign of being welcomed into the tribe by the chief as family. The meetinghouse is decorated with impeccably carved masks. The chins and cheeks of the masks are decorated with swirls imitating tribal body art. The piney fragrance fills the room. Drums beat. People begin to chant, and you watch the vibrant history of the Maori come to life.

dayInfo.title: Wellington - Deeper into the Middle
dayInfo.description: Today you will transfer from Rotorua to New Zealand’s capital, Wellington. Surrounded by fertile hills that edge the city closer to its adjacent bay, Wellington is a glistening city filled with as much beauty and activity as its incredible surroundings. The city is a fabulous place to explore and boasts more restaurants per capita than New York City. Cable cars pass through Lambton Quay. People bustle through the streets along with the mixture of triangular, stone buildings, and modern architecture. The musk of fresh, rich coffee drifts from the cafes that line the street. Pay a leisurely visit to a local cafe known as the place to see and be seen. The inside resembles an outdoor café and offers a selection of stunning New Zealand and Australian wines, along with an incredibly tasty flat white.

dayInfo.title: Wellington - The Magic of Middle Earth
dayInfo.description: Dive deeper into Middle Earth by exploring the various beautiful areas in and around Wellington that created the expansive beauty of the film. Kaitoke Regional Park is filled with crystal-like rivers and stunning rainforest that was the perfect location for Rivendell. Walk along the suspension bridge, the sound of the rushing river rising from below. The smell of evergreen surrounds the bridge. The woods are flourishing and dense. This is where Frodo recovered from his stab wound by a Morgul-blade. Travel through Tongariro National Park where Gimli, Legolas, and Aragorn wandered through the Paths of the Dead. The pinnacles rise into the sky like jagged, gray trees. Gravel, rain, wind, and floods eroded the silt and rock over time creating this breathtaking display of natural pillars that stand tall and resemble the columns of a castle. With so much of Middle Earth to see you will end your exploration of the Wellington and Middle Earth at the Weta Workshop which houses a range of disciplines under one roof and which created many of the props used in th e Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit . Weta Workshop built weapons, armor, chainmail, and much more for the films and continues to create incredible displays. No journey through Middle Earth would be complete without a visit, and possibly a swing of a sword.

dayInfo.title: Wellington - Taste of Middle Earth
dayInfo.description: Today you will explore Wellington’s fabulous food culture with a guide and chef. Stroll along the streets of the Courtenay and Cuba quarters that brim with vibrant life, also known as the city’s 24-hour neighborhoods. Music pulses from nightclubs, eccentric aromas drift out of the impressive number of restaurants and cafes, and small boutique shops mingle with it all. Pastel colors decorate the shops during the day and are brightly lit by neon at night. Many universities surround the area giving extraordinary life to the neighborhood year-round. Stop into the Matterhorn for a drink where the outdoor patio flickers in firelight and the smell of rich and freshly brewed coffee wafts from the bar. The wooden framed interior will transport you to the Alps in no time. One of their signature cocktails, like the smoky and tart combination of the Holy Smoke, is a fantastic excuse to sit back and stay a while.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - The Queen of Middle Earth
dayInfo.description: Today you will transfer from the dramatic beauty of Wellington and it’s surroundings to the breathtaking awe of the South Island. Arrive in Queenstown, an alpine city situated on the shores of Lake Wakatipu and the foothills of the Remarkables Mountain range. The snow topped peaks line the sky. The lake gleams in the sunlight. The breeze flows down from Bob’s peak and brings with it the fresh bark and pine sent of the Alps. The streets are lined with stores and restaurants with blended facades of wood and stone. Treat yourself this evening with a visit to an award-winning restaurant with a chef who creates exceptional and surprising dishes; the flavors linger in your mouth and your thoughts long after the meal is over.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Fly Over Middle Earth
dayInfo.description: Today you will climb aboard a helicopter and tour Queenstown’s incredible surroundings that will bring you face to face with some of Middle Earth’s most breathtaking scenery, along with bringing you face to face with Alfie Speight, who was the principle filming pilot for the Lord of the Rings films. The Remarkables begin to sink below you as you climb into the sky, Lake Wakatipu shrinking on the receding earth. Look below you and see the Shotover River. The image of Arewen is clear in your mind. She sits on her white horse and stands in the river. The water is barely up to the horse’s ankles. The mountains are covered in evergreen. The Nazgul follow Arwen into the river and you can see her summons bring the rush of the pristine water through the mountains and wash away the pursuing vagrants of Nazgul. Fly along the white blanket of Mt. Earnslaw. The exceptional glacier sits along the range. The mountain pass is plush green and dotted with tiny waterfalls that stem from the glacial water that adorns the mountaintop. The glacier emits a pure aroma of water and crunches beneath your feet. The ice is cold against your fingertips. The rock below the glacier is gray until it gives way to the lush grass that sprouts from the consistent water. Look over Mt. Earnslaw, the bright white snow giving way to the a series of people wading through the treacherous path of the Redhorn Pass that lies beneath the slopes of Caradhras and was predominantly used by traveling elves. Like the traveling elves and the nine members of the Fellowship you will make it through Redhorn Pass and many more treacherously beautiful sites of Middle Earth that blanket the South Island.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Soar Over Queenstown
dayInfo.description: Make your way up the Skyline Gondola, the steepest gondola in the Southern Hemisphere where the entire city of Queenstown opens up before you. The shore of Lake Wakatipu laps beneath the boardwalk. The Remarkables roll into the distance, and the city sits quiet beneath you. The air is crisp and the smell of pine needles fills the brush. Your professional guide will strap you into the protective gear, ensure your safety, and you will glide across the panorama of Queenstown, between the abundant trees atop Bob’s Peak and watch the opal blue lake sparkle in the sun. Whether silently drifting through the sky or zipping down the line, the colors of Queenstown become more vibrant and the mountain range that sits beyond the lake seems to shrink, as if you can see every rock, blade of grass, and snowflake that decorates the distance.

dayInfo.title: Glenorchy - The Road to Mordor
dayInfo.description: Hike along the shores of Lake Wakatipu, taking the stunning road to Mordor, where the rocky mountains begin to separate themselves from one another becoming a singular mountain instead of the image of a range. The lake is opal in the mid-morning sky. The water reflects the mountains and the trees. The trees and grass sway in the breeze. The city of Queenstown fades into the distance as you make your way to Glenorchy. Once in Glenorchy you will climb aboard for an incredible jet boat tour of the Dart River. The water is emerald green and surrounded by pristine banks crowded with blooming gorse. The banks fluctuate between verdant forests and grass, to pebbled beaches and boulders. The mountains fade from white tips to deep gray foothills. The cool, fresh water mists your face. The wind wisps through your clothing. The woodlands shape and form next to the river, the thin tall trees that made Lothlorien and sit beneath the lower Misty Mountains.

dayInfo.title: Glenorchy - A Journey of Doubt
dayInfo.description: Today you will transfer to Manapouri to experience the incredible majesty of Doubtful Sound. Located inside the Fiordland National Park, Doubtful Sound is three times larger than the famous Milford Sound. Cruise through the sound in style on a three-masted staysail. The waterway opens up before you. The sails catch the breeze and push the boat forward. The vessel feels dwarfed between the goliath mountains that encircle the sound. The air is cool and quiet. The mountains are vibrant and green in the brilliant sky. Bottlenose dolphins often swim around the sound, their silver bodies shimmering beneath the clear water. They love to jump and dive next to the boat, showing off for the people aboard as you make your way around the stunning glaciers that drip water down the mountainsides. The sound of crashing water echoes in the silence. The valley was carved by glacial activity which still remains. Penguins are also occasionally seen flying through the water and drying their feathers along the rocky shores. Whether dolphins, penguins, glaciers, or pristine water, Doubtful Sound has you enter the world of Tolkien and Jackson once again, whether used in the films or not, to experience its surreal and breathtaking beauty.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Return To Queenstown
dayInfo.description: Wake up and smell the fresh and cool air of Doubtful Sound. Soon you will be returning to Queenstown but take advantage of the morning to explore the sound once more. The water is cold on your fingertips. The icy, salty air brushes your skin. But the world is quiet. The sound is breathtaking, and if you had to throw a cursed ring into a volcano you know you wouldn’t mind passing through Doubtful Sound to do it. A return to Queenstown brings with it the reemerging beauty of Lake Wakatipu, the Remarkables, and Bob’s Peak. The alpine city is quaint and contains a vibrant life. Stroll through the city, the streets lively day or night. The laughter of night spills onto the sidewalks. The cologne of creamy garlic and mussels drifts from the restaurants and the serene splendor of the day is exchanged for lamps and starlight by night.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - One Tour to Rule Them All
dayInfo.description: As Frodo’s adventure eventually came to an end, so shall yours. From the quaint residencies of the shire to the tumultuous paths into Mordor you have followed Frodo and Samwise across Middle Earth, into the depths of New Zealand, and back again. Today you will transfer to the Queenstown Airport for your flight home. As you ascend into the sky the Remarkables pass beneath you. The glistening water of Lake Wakatipu disappears. The rolling hills of Hobbiton shrink away. But like Frodo’s voyage to destroy the ring, the journey may have come to an end but the adventure never will; there will always be more to see and another adventure to have.

tourName: Luxury Escape to New Zealand: Enthralling Nature and Delightful Cities Tour
placesVisited: Rotorua, Napier, Wellington & the Wairarap, Picton, Christchurch, Aoraki / Mt. Cook Nationa, Queenstown, Milford Sound, Auckland
generalInfo: Visit New Zealand’s iconic destinations and experience the country’s essential highlights on this grand, 14-day luxury tour tailored to the most discerning of travelers. From the dazzling cityscape of Auckland to the verdant wine-producing vineyards of Napier and the towering glacial summits of Mount Cook to the forested geological wonders of Milford Sound, experience the best of New Zealand along the way.

dayInfo.title: Auckland - Welcome to Paradise
dayInfo.description: Poised between the Pacific Ocean and the Tasman Sea and boasting flourishing rainforests and expansive bush, Auckland is a dreamy metropolitan that features something for everyone. You will arrive at the international airport where you will be collected by your private transfer and whisked away to your gorgeous luxe accommodation stationed in the heart of the city. From here, you may stroll along tree-lined boulevards to exquisite restaurants serving divine New Zealand cuisine and immerse yourself in the atmospheric first stop on your extravagant vacation.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - Illustrious Landscapes of New Zealand
dayInfo.description: Between Auckland and Rotorua, your next destination, lies an impressive expanse of lush wildlands home to a marvelous collection of endemic wildlife you may spot on your way to your spectacular lakeside accommodation. After checking in, you may step onto the deck of your stellar suite to catch a glimpse of the glittering Tarawera lake. This intimate hideaway home is the perfect place to swoon over the natural paradise before you visit landscapes made famous in the Lord of the Rings trilogy and witness rock formations borne from the country’s geothermal activity.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua - Scenes from the Sky
dayInfo.description: Today, you will see Rotorua’s staggering untouched wilderness from a unique vantage point as you take to the skies in a private plane set to swoop over the remarkable stretches of land. Peering out of the window, you will lay your eyes upon the soaring forested summits of Mount Tarawera and the winding azure streams of the Waikato River. Your plane will soon land, and you will be allowed to freely explore the volcanic terrain, dipping your toes into the bubbling hot springs and admiring the proliferating greenery.

dayInfo.title: Napier - Bewitching Displays of Geothermal Activity
dayInfo.description: You will travel further along the New Zealand countryside this morning after breakfast as you transfer from Rotorua southbound for Napier. The journey will reveal more spectacular geothermal scenes, including sizzling mud pits and steaming geysers that compose the volcanic landscape. Approaching Napier, you may stop by the pounding silver waters of the Huka Falls, an awe-inspiring waterfall beating down an 11-meter drop into the natural pool below. You will soon arrive at your exquisite boutique farm-style accommodation hosted at an esteemed farmland retreat hemmed into the emerald hills.

dayInfo.title: Napier - Divine Delicacies and Sumptuous Wines
dayInfo.description: The morning sunshine will envelop Napier’s farmlands in a golden glow, illuminating the landscape as far as the eye can see and nourishing the blossoming buds that blanket parts of the untouched region. After breakfast, you will tour Napier’s acclaimed wine country, stopping at a revered estate that portrays the country’s devotion to decadent wines. Settled in at a table on the estate’s stylish terrace, you will explore the nuances of flavor distinct to each bottle prepared by the local makers while tucking into a delightful spread of delectable dishes paired perfectly with the wines.

dayInfo.title: Wellington - Golden Visions of New Zealand’s Farmlands
dayInfo.description: Traveling to Wellington today, you will cruise through the rich farmlands that sweep the countryside of the Hawke’s Bay. Between images of the endless golden fields and the array of fluffy white sheep, you will be charmed by New Zealand’s endearing rural landscapes before you arrive at the country’s thriving capital. After dropping off your belongings at your royal suite, you may take pleasure in a light stroll along the promenade alongside the sparkling sea views and indulge in an assortment of gourmet meals prepared at one of the many award-winning restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Picton - Gliding Gently across the Sparkling Sea
dayInfo.description: You will make your way from Wellington to Picton today, a distance which you will cover mostly by ferry. Arguably one of the most beautiful ferry rides in the world – the voyage will be nothing short of perfection. Gently gliding across the shimmering navy waters, you will cross the paths of many iconic points of interest and take in the myriad of landscape and seascape scenes that will present themselves on the way before you draw nearer the remarkable sounds hugging the coastline of Picton.

dayInfo.title: Picton - The Fruits of a Labor of Love
dayInfo.description: Picton is positioned in one of New Zealand’s most majestic destinations, a scenery composed of rolling olive-green hills brushing a twinkling blue coastal sea. But even more so, beyond the bay lies a countryside veiled in vegetation where life flourishes uninterrupted by the spoils of man. Today, you will venture to these bewitching parts of Picton to relish the prestigious wines produced at elite estates hemmed into the illustrious hills. From wine tasting to chocolate nibbling, you will take delight in the delicacies prepared in the mesmerizing hills of Picton.

dayInfo.title: Christchurch - Gorgeous Seascapes along the Kaikoura Coastline
dayInfo.description: After breakfast this morning, you will make your way to Christchurch along the impressive Kaikoura coastline. Zigzagging along the tarred road the hugs the coast, you may catch glimpses of endemic birdlife hovering overhead and singing from the trees flanking the road, or even New Zealand fur seals, which may lie lazily sunbathing on boulders jutting out of the sea. Dubbed one of New Zealand’s prime whale-watching towns, you may spot them swimming beyond the shores before continuing to your decadent accommodation in Christchurch.

dayInfo.title: Aoraki - Alpine Discoveries from Soaring Heights
dayInfo.description: Tuck into a sumptuous breakfast spread before packing up your things and continuing your New Zealand tour from Christchurch to Mount Cook. Making your way to the icy mountains of Mount Cook, you will pass through the bewildering golden landscapes of the Canterbury Plains, a stark contrast to the scenes that await you in Mount Cook. AS you approach your destination, these vistas will give way to hills topped with snow rising to meet the clouds, and you will admire these alpine panoramas from a private helicopter shortly after arriving.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Refuge on the Banks of Lake Wakatipu
dayInfo.description: Beginning your journey away from the alpine summits of Mount Cook, you will transfer through the lakeside town of Twizel towards the Lindis Pass. From there, continue on to Gibbston Valley wine region before arriving in Queenstown. As you approach Queenstown, the towering crests of the Remarkables Mountains will come into view and vistas of Lake Wakatipu will flow beneath these mighty peaks. Here, alongside the tranquil waters of the lake, you will find refuge in a boutique accommodation fringing its banks.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - All that Queenstown has to Offer
dayInfo.description: Queenstown, the adventure capital of New Zealand, is yours to explore freely on the twelfth day of your vacation. There are several activities to partake in during the day, each offering a way to discover the natural beauty circling the destination and delve into the culture sweeping its spirited districts. Whether you wish to zip across the gleaming waters of the lake on a jet boat weaving past the looming jagged cliffs or settle in at a Michelin-starred restaurant serving palate-pleasing delicacies, there is something for everyone to enjoy in Queenstown.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - The Wonders of the Milford Sound
dayInfo.description: Beyond being beautiful in and of itself, Queenstown is also a gateway to the iconic Milford Sound of New Zealand. To witness this incredible geological phenomenon, you will hover into the sky onboard a private helicopter and swoon over the surroundings with a birds-eye view. As a result of tremendous rainfall battering this region throughout the year, an environmental exhibition of mossy rocks, dense rainforest, and vast rivers await those you eagerly take to the skies to witness the majestic natural wonders of the Milford Sound.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown - Luxurious Memories of Your Travels
dayInfo.description: As day breaks and your last day is upon you, you may enjoy it slowly while taking in the surrounding environmental beauty carpeting Queenstown from your balcony. Shortly after relishing a mouth-watering breakfast alongside views of the glimmering lake, you will pack your belongings and meet your private transfer. You will be taken to the international airport where you will board your flight headed home and say your last goodbyes to the wondrous country of New Zealand. Until next time, you will return home with many marvelous memories of your luxurious travels.

tourName: Luxury New Zealand Family Vacation
placesVisited: Bay of Islands, Rotorua, Christchurch, Queenstown
generalInfo: Effortlessly blending natural superlatives with child friendly adventure, this custom tailored luxury vacation brings New Zealand to life for the whole family. Tranquility merges with exhilaration, sumptuous lodges hide amongst inspiring landscapes, and every activity holds the attention of both children and adults. Travel time is kept to a bare minimum and each of your four destinations burst with endless opportunity to explore New Zealand at its most authentic.

dayInfo.title: Welcome to New Zealand
dayInfo.description: As the plane descends into New Zealand you take in the aerials, the deep blue ocean water juxtaposed with the North Island’s rolling green landscapes. Even from this vantage point you admire a country of idiosyncrasy. You’ll be met at Auckland International upon arrival, a representative assisting your family as you transfer to a domestic flight to the Bay of Islands. Then at Kerikeri Airport your rental vehicle keys are waiting, the vacation kicking off with the country’s unruffled ease and relaxed style. Clear turquoise waters sooth any travel aches and the thick green topography guides you to the renowned Eagles Nest in Russell. From up here the views are endless, a plethora of tiny islands twinkling in the ocean water, and the Bay of Islands welcoming you for four days of exploratory bliss. After a long international flight you’ll want some rest and recovery time, so indulge in what the Eagles Nest can offer. World class villas feature private Jacuzzis, and are equipped with a gourmet kitchen, home theater system, contemporary furnishings, and hidden locations amongst the 75 acre gardens. It’s hard to believe you’re within walking distance of Russell’s historic town, the villa blending into the green topography and foliage. Soak up the serenity and dip into the private heated horizon-edge pool; those astonishing vistas omnipresent throughout your four days.

dayInfo.title: Sailing Around the Spectacular Bay of Islands
dayInfo.description: 144 islands cover this bay, the majority of them uninhabited and inaccessible by land. Secluded bays hide behind green canopies, marine brilliance dances through the water, and pristine beaches almost never bear footprints. The only way to truly explore and appreciate the beauty is by boat. And what a boat your family has today! A 50 foot pedigree racing yacht (expertly skippered of course) takes you on an adventure into the Bay of Islands that few other tourists get to discover. Stop at sheltered bays where children of all ages can safely swim, relax beside glorious beaches, and cruise through an achingly beautiful and untouched landscape.

dayInfo.title: Stunning Scenic Flight Over the North of New Zealand
dayInfo.description: With the children’s faces covered in excitement, you climb aboard a small fixed wing aircraft, the far North of New Zealand revealing itself as you gently ascend. The cruising altitude offers visual intoxication; you’re high enough to appreciate an immense wide angle panorama, yet low enough to pick out the distinct detail. Fly along the Ninety Mile Beach, then cruise inland and land on a tiny runway close to the Cape Reinga Lighthouse. The family adventure continues…An air-conditioned minibus provides ground exploration, taking you across to Tapotupotu Bay and a quick swim in glorious waters. Next it’s giant sand dunes, the children (and probably the adults) taking sleds and sand surfing down this visual wonder. After heartbeats have risen and hundreds of photos have been taken, you board the plane again, the returning scenic flight delivering arguably the finest coastal scenery anywhere in the country.

dayInfo.title: A Family Orientated Nature Walk Through Northland’s Most Scenic Reserve
dayInfo.description: The untamed far North of New Zealand has a diverse majesty and beauty. Rocky bluffs, waterfalls, historical sites, fascinating flora, improbable fauna, Maori history; it’s all unveiled in just three hours as you go on a guided walk and boat trip into Northland’s most scenic reserve. An indelibly laid-back Kiwi character provides the narrative, keeping the whole family entertained with stories and insights into the rich natural diversity. The nature walk is just over three miles long, going at a very leisurely pace (this is New Zealand, after all) and featuring dozens of stops. It’s supplemented by a boat cruise through Whangaroa Harbour, yet another highlight of your time in the Bay of Islands. Like every day here, your free time is filled with possibility. Choose to relax at your sumptuous accommodation, use the rental vehicle to explore intriguing corners of the Islands, or take in the quaint cozy atmosphere of Russell and other small nearby towns.

dayInfo.title: Into the Heart of Maori Culture
dayInfo.description: Today you fly south, following the extinct volcanic ridges and arriving on the Central Plateau. Rotorua hums with Maori culture, this town of bursting geysers the spiritual heartbeat of the country’s endearing indigenous residents. Few destinations offer families such a rich choice of activities, yet can simultaneously wrap the whole experience in a unique cultural blanket. Nestled on a lifestyle farm, just 15 minute’s drive from Central Rotorua, the elegant Hamurana Country Estate provides your base for the next four nights. You’re tucked away in peaceful privacy, yet close enough to the adventurous wonders of Rotorua. With a new rental vehicle there’s hundreds of places to explore in the surrounding area, although it may be hard to prize yourself away from the estate’s idyllic backdrop. Hamurana’s on-site restaurant always comes well recommended for evening meals.

dayInfo.title: Bubbling Mud and Exploding Geysers at the Wai-O-Tapu Thermal Wonderland
dayInfo.description: Rotorua sits above insatiable volcanic activity, rumblings from the earth’s core thundering out of holes in the crust. Mud bubbles evocatively, mirages of steam float across pre-historic looking rock formations, huge volcanic craters stand in their ancient glory, and sinter terrace formations take the eye on a merry dance. Wai-O-Tapu features all these thermal wonders and you explore at your own pace, absorbing the unique geology and natural surprises. Then at 10:15 am Lady Knox explodes, Wai-O-Tapu’s famous geyser sending a huge flume of water some 60 feet into the air. Even if you had heard the underground murmurs, nobody would have expected such a sudden and ferocious explosion. Children are often left spellbound. After the excitement comes some calm, the world-famous champagne pool bringing a gentle smile to every face.

dayInfo.title: Thrilling Rangitaiki White Water Rafting
dayInfo.description: The Rangitaiki River offers a soothing sight, the water gushing through a pristine green landscape bursting with nuance. It’s lost in a wild landscape of overhanging greenery and volcanic shaped geography, merely an hour’s drive from Rotorua. Climb aboard an inflatable raft and the river transforms into thrilling adventure, nine miles of rapids winding their way deep into hidden New Zealand. Grade two and three rapids get everyone’s heart racing, the water splashing into the raft as the whole family furiously paddles away. These surges of excitement are complimented by gentle stretches for laying back and admiring the scenery. A hearty picnic-style lunch is served in the most picturesque of settings, the sounds of laughter and water filling the air. More rapids follow, although for safety reasons, children will be walked around a set of Grade 4 rapids. After around four hours on the water you return to Hamurana around 4:30 pm, the children tired but ecstatic, and the graceful estate always offering a serene evening together.

dayInfo.title: Immersion in Maori Traditions and Mitai Cultural Performance
dayInfo.description: Maori culture never fades into the background in Rotorua. You’ll already have discovered many traditions during the past three days and this cultural enthrallment is amplified with an evening at Mitai. Traditionally dressed warriors paddle down the Wai-o-whiro stream, their wooden canoe, or waka , effortlessly navigated through the natural bush. A cultural performance reveals songs and dance and, while this is a show for visitors, these performances have become an essential way for Maori locals to continue their ancient traditions. Without this opportunity, their rich heritage might slip away over just a couple of generations. They demonstrate an innate ability to work with the landscape, epitomized by your evening feast. Large cuts of meat are roasted underground, the naturally heated volcanic rock providing the perfect oven for joints of lamb, beef, and pork, not to mention all the vegetable trimmings. Sit down to this traditional hangi meal and don’t miss tonight’s opportunity to witness glowworms in their natural habitat. Like each day in Rotorua, having a rental vehicle enables you to tailor your free time and enjoy many sides of this mesmeric area.

dayInfo.title: The Endearing Optimism of Christchurch
dayInfo.description: Domestic flights make traveling with a family easy in New Zealand. There are no long drives to negotiate, and all the airports are close to city centers and your accommodation. Within a couple of hours of leaving Hamurana you'll have landed in Christchurch. This city hit the news a few years ago when a devastating earthquake ripped it in two. Some might expect doom and gloom. Yet the ebullience and determination of the residents surrounds you. Huge areas have been ingeniously restored and visitors are always welcomed with captivating optimism. Your host at the 40 Thornycroft Bed and Breakfast epitomizes the local’s charm. Turning her delightful place into more of a home stay than a bed and breakfast, Vivienne Turner is your hostess for the next three nights. She’s particularly great with children and will be full of unique ideas for discovering the city. So pick up your rental vehicle from Christchurch Airport and get ready for one of the planet’s most fascinating cities.

dayInfo.title: Hot Air Ballooning Above Beautiful Canterbury
dayInfo.description: Canterbury’s landscape is ideal for ballooning, the gently floating craft ascending above the parks, rivers, and buildings of the city. It’s an early rise today, the pre-dawn start ensuring a flight at the most beautiful time of day. With the sun piercing the horizon you coast up high, the rivers fading into a patchwork of farmland and the Canterbury Plains. The Southern Alps twinkle in the distance, and the inexhaustible ocean blue extends to the east. It’s a tranquil and benevolent journey; each angle will have your finger pressing the camera shutter. Yet it’s also filled with excitement. How many times does the whole family get to take a hot air balloon ride together? After four to five hours you return to the ground and the rest of the day is free to explore Christchurch.

dayInfo.title: Cruising Alongside Dolphins and Discovering History
dayInfo.description: Dolphins dance through the water, delighting children’s eyes as they glide alongside your boat. These are Hector’s dolphins, the smallest (and probably the cutest) of the dolphin species and are only found in New Zealand. A two hour wildlife cruise gets you up close, the playful marine beauties just part of a whole ecosystem of unique sea and bird life. Your family can get closer, with activities such as sea kayaking and swimming with dolphins available as optional extras in the historic settlement of Akaroa. Being in the water with these fun loving mammals is an unforgettable experience for children. Like everywhere in New Zealand, a volcanic backdrop keeps you company throughout the day, and there’s an indelible serenity to the inimitable activities. Akaroa is just an hour’s drive from Christchurch.

dayInfo.title: The Luxuriant Splendor of Queenstown
dayInfo.description: After dropping the rental vehicle at Christchurch Airport you fly south once more, snow-tinged peaks and resplendent lakes guiding your journey to Queenstown. Tucked between jaw-dropping mountains, and standing over a lush blue lake, this is one of New Zealand’s most visually spectacular destinations. Pick up the rental vehicle and indulge in the views, idyllic natural landscapes rising above near deserted roads and perfectly triangular peaks tinged with white. Complementing the visual splendor is the sheer luxury of the Remarkables Lodge. Spacious living areas abound; a sun lounge stands beside a hydrotherapy spa and sauna, while the cozy bar and swimming pool mingle with many spots for admiring the view. The resident chef has a great reputation, and he cooks up sumptuous three course dinners using the freshest of New Zealand’s produce. These table d’hôte meals are included in your itinerary, along with pre-dinner drinks and canapés.

dayInfo.title: Something for the Whole Family at Cardrona Adventure Park
dayInfo.description: Cardrona Adventure Park bursts with excitement and offers a level for everyone. Get behind the wheel of a huge variety of monster trucks, the rides suitable for everyone from beginner to complete adrenalin junkie. Children can climb up the steps and jump in for the ride, or they can drive the world’s biggest school bus monster truck. Children’s quad bikes, go-karts, all terrain vehicles, off-road racing cars; there’s a vehicle for every size and every ability level. And when the roaring metal and exhilaration becomes too much, the tranquility of the Remarkables Lodge is just nearby.

dayInfo.title: Spectacular Dart River Jet Boat Safari
dayInfo.description: Jagged peaks tower over the Dart River, dominating a rugged wilderness without boundary. Your 90 minute jet boat journey splashes along, traversing the transparent water and scenically cutting deep into the Mt Aspiring National Park. Like most of New Zealand, this jet boat ride effortlessly blends thrills with tranquility, and nature with unique adventure. Disembark beside ancient forests, admiring just how much the landscape looks like a Peter Jackson Hollywood epic. Don’t be surprised at the comparisons; The Hobbit and Lord of the Rings were filmed in this corner of the world. While it’s not actually Middle Earth, these forests have remained unchanged for 80 million years, and guided commentary picks up on a narrative of mystery and history. Spot more Hollywood comparisons on the journey back to Queenstown, a winding road taking you through paradise and back to the lodge. What’s Included: Dart River jet boat safari, overnight at Remarkables Lodge with three course dinner and breakfast

dayInfo.title: The Ultimate Scenic Helicopter Flight
dayInfo.description: Fjordland National Park glimmers beneath the sun, hidden glaciers and impassable peaks coated in layers of white. Inspiring ice formations extend across the landscape, crevasses offer views into the abyss, and lakes stand silent in the crisp morning air. Some of this can be glimpsed from a road or walking track. But almost all of Fjordland has never been tamed. To really see this natural wonder you need an aircraft, something with the ability to fly low between the mountains and land on isolated glaciers. The Milford Ultimate Heli-Scenic Flight is an incredible way to round out this once-in-a-lifetime vacation, the family transported to places that rarely see human eyes. Explore the heart of this epic expanse, the 2500 foot Sutherland Falls thundering away from close quarters and the helicopter touching down on a huge glacier in the midst of the wilderness. It’s hard to know which way to look; the astounding lake down below, perhaps the artistically framed ice formations, maybe the complete panorama of peaks, or the white mirage that fills the window. Stop for lunch at a remote Musterer’s Cabin then return to the air, children’s eyes filled with amazement as the natural scenes keep coming. Now comes a famous landing at the Moonlight and Shotover Canyons, and the last three and a half hours have flown by. What’s Included: Milford Ultimate Heli-Scenic Flight, overnight at Remarkables Lodge with three course dinner and breakfast

dayInfo.title: Fond Farewells from New Zealand
dayInfo.description: After 15 days of family adventure you return the rental car to Queenstown Airport and bid a fond farewell to this nation of superlatives. You’ll catch a domestic flight to either Christchurch or Auckland and connect with your international departure filled with family memories that will last a lifetime. What’s Included: breakfast at Remarkables Lodge For traveler experiences, read New Zealand travel reviews.

tourName: Luxury New Zealand Honeymoon
placesVisited: Kaikoura, Marlborough, Rai Valley, Abel Tasman National Park, Wanaka, Queenstown, Doubtful Sound
generalInfo: The romantic view of the snowcapped Remarkables Mountain Range sits outside your veranda. Your secluded room in the treetops gives you the vast expanse of the open valley. The luscious flavors of award-winning vineyards are yours to taste. The opulent water of the river rushes below you. This is your honeymoon in New Zealand, where the landscape is breathtaking, the people are friendly, the fun is never-ending, and the honeymoon never has to stop.

dayInfo.title: Kaikoura – A Budding Romance
dayInfo.description: Your romantic journey through New Zealand begins in Christchurch, the Garden City, where the Avon River meanders through the parks, gardens, and the city center. The cobblestone streets, trolley cars, and budding gardens give you the feeling that you have landed in Switzerland, as the surroundings of Christchurch are lush with rolling hills, adding to the charm and beauty of the city and the South Island. Enjoy a romantic cruise down the Avon, where the vibrant lupines blossom along the riverbanks and daisies glow in the distance amongst the grass. The scent of fresh flowers embraces you as you drift along the calm water. The adventure continues as you make your way to Kaikoura. The city is nuzzled between the snowcapped and glistening Seaward Kaikoura Mountains and the South Pacific Ocean. Settle into the secluded luxuries of the Hapuku Lodge and Tree House. Your accommodation sits amongst the canopy as the mountains linger outside your door and the ocean shore laps outside your window. The fresh scent of citrus and pine emanates from the treetops. You can rest comfortably, quietly, and privately just above the surface of the valley below.

dayInfo.title: Kaikoura – An Intimate Swim
dayInfo.description: Today you will have the unique experience to swim with dusky dolphins with the guidance of New Zealand’s first operator to offer a watch and swim tour. The boat weighs anchor and the soft, sweet scent of the ocean surrounds you. The dolphins begin to play in the boat’s wake as you come closer to the pods. Whether from the dry deck of the boat or beneath the surface of the water, you will never miss a second of the dolphins’ eccentric curiosity and playfulness. You can feel the cold water on your cheeks as you immerse yourself in the South Pacific Ocean. The pods can grow to several hundred strong, all leaping from the water and diving beneath the surface. Swim next to them as the try to race one another and you. Try to breach the surface with the speed and elegance of the dolphins, their black and white skin shimmering in the sun. The mountains in the distance call you back, and the intimate swim with the dusky dolphins comes to an end. The secluded beauty of the Hapuku Lodge soothes and indulges you.

dayInfo.title: Kaikoura – Uniquely Your Own
dayInfo.description: Today you will once again wade out into the water for a fabulous whale-watching excursion. During the season you can see pods of whales from the shores of the city, but today will give you the opportunity to get close to the pods in their natural environment. The sea breeze blows through your hair as the bay recedes into the distance. The boat sways in the calm water. You can hear the puff of a blowhole; the spray wisps out from the water. From the gentle pod of Humpback whales to the incredible girth of the Blue whale, the experience is uniquely yours. Watch the whales breech the ocean surface, crashing back down into the water with incredible force. You can hear their cry muddled from beneath the sea. The dusky dolphins often make an appearance and play next to the boat and even next to the whales. Eventually, the whales continue along their journey and you make your way back to shore.

dayInfo.title: Marlborough – Romantic New Zealand Countryside
dayInfo.description: Take leave of the stunning city of Kaikoura and make your way to the fabulous region of Marlborough by way of Blenheim. Just outside of the city you will see a sensational amount of seals sunbathing on the rocks. Their barks and scurries mix with the crashing waves. The road travels along the Pacific Coast and eventually through the salt works at Lake Grassmere. For a unique visit, stop at Sawcut Gorge. The limestone walls are smooth and damp. The water is clear and cold to the touch. Whether you want to linger in the rushing water or wander amongst the beautiful flora, the gorge will always inspire. Once in Marlborough you will cozy up into the luxuries of a wine country cottage. The soft décor, the luscious estate, and the interesting history help create the decadent charm of the five-star accommodation. Sit along the patio of your cottage and watch the vineyards expand into the foothills. The mountains stand tall on the horizon as the sun begins to set, making the valley glow in the dwindling light.

dayInfo.title: Marlborough – A Lovely Taste of the South Island
dayInfo.description: Taste the love and romance that goes into the Sauvignon Capital of the World on a delicious wine tour of the area. Due to the high sunshine and an easy climate, the sweeping mountains and diverse soil, there is an exceptional array of varietals no matter the time of year. With over 40 vineyards offering tastes of their award-winning wines and their personal favorites, take advantage of the depth and multiplicity of flavors. Saint Clair’s Sauvignon Blanc is perfumed with passion fruit and blackcurrant, with a rich palate, and a silky long finish. However the luscious wine of the Kim Crawford Vineyard offers hints of grapefruit and green apple, accented with apricot. The bright acidic finish gives a lingering freshness to your taste buds. But more than the flavors of the wines is the awesome and romantic scenery, bursting with green vineyards and rolling mountains. The scent of rich earth fills the valley and the sky opens up to unparalleled blue. As the sun sets over the valley you can watch the blue fade to an enrapturing blend of purple and orange as you settle into the delightful evening.

dayInfo.title: Rai Valley – The Secluded Valley
dayInfo.description: Today you will leave behind the luscious flavors and expansive sky of Marlborough and make your way to the majestic seclusion of the Rai Valley. The cottage feel of your lodge is quaint and eloquent. The lodge is scented with cedar, surrounded by an expanse of tall trees and open farmland. The perfect blend of luxury accommodation and privacy, you can hear the bleating lambs scampering through the brush, the whinny of horses as they trot along the tree line, and the quiet rustling of leaves as the breeze blows softly through.

dayInfo.title: Rai Valley – A Private Escape
dayInfo.description: Hop along the famous horses of New Zealand where the characteristics of reliable and friendly go beyond defining just the people. Traverse the farmland, the forest, and the marshes on a tender horseback adventure. The trees tower high above the Pelorus riverbanks, strewn with golden grass and smoothed rocks. The gentle trickle of the river lingers in the air. The soft bounce of the horse’s trot drives you forward. Whether you prefer a short jaunt along the river or a more romantic endeavor that includes the decadent fizz of a champagne lunch, the ride through Rai Valley is more like a dream than an adventure.

dayInfo.title: Abel Tasman – Natural Beauty and You
dayInfo.description: You will depart from the secluded beauty of Rai Valley and make your way to the fabulous city of Nelson and the majestic Abel Tasman. Nelson is situated within the magnificence of cool alpine lakes, raging rivers, and expansive sapphire coastlines. The scent of berries, olives, and pears fills the orchards and grapes and hops are also handcrafted into divine wines and unique beers. The surrounding bay offers sensational fish, scallops, and clams cooked to perfection in the many restaurants within Nelson’s city center, where the decadent scent of mussels steeped in garlic and cream drifts out from the open restaurant doors. From the light crash of the opulent sea to the gentle rustle of the orchard leaves, the natural beauty of Nelson is all-encompassing and all around. Continue on to your fabulous Abel Tasman accommodations overlooking the picturesque Tasman Bay. The lodge is situated between the ocean and the mountains, beneath the vast clear and sunny sky. The tide laps at the shore. Birds feed in the shallow water. The scent of freshly blossomed roses surrounds the lodge as you wander through towering trees and swaying grass. Relax in style and comfort as the sun spreads its light on the sea and sinks comfortably over the horizon.

dayInfo.title: Abel Tasman – Adoring Flights of Fancy
dayInfo.description: Today you will experience the stunning beauty of Abel Tasman by both land and sea as you climb into a helicopter and head deep into Abel Tasman National Park and through Tonga Marine Reserve. From the sky you can see the opulent sapphire color of the sea. The forest is dense and rich as the helicopter sets down and you climb aboard your kayak. The water is cold on your toes. The air is crisp and warm. The scent of the sweet seawater drifts from the ocean. The water changes colors from sapphire to jade as the sun glides across the sky. Sea lions laze on the cool boulders jetting from the rocky shore. You can see dorsal fins floating next to your kayak. The cold cools your skin in the warm afternoon. The hot sand of the shores is inviting. Stroll through the lush trees to Awaroa Lodge where a delicious lunch awaits. You can hear the Tui sing in the trees. The scent of fresh fish and golden potatoes wafts from your plate before you embark once more by helicopter to make your way back to your lodge.

dayInfo.title: Wanaka – The Dream of Relaxing Luxury
dayInfo.description: Today you will board a domestic flight that will take you to the sensational beauty of Wanaka where a five-star retreat awaits you. Wanaka is known for its reflectively clear lake, the Crown Ranges, golden fields, and its isolation. Winding rivers stretch along the valleys, native beech forests loom beneath the dramatic glaciers of the Southern Alps, and lush alpine meadows glow in the sun. Nuzzled on the outskirts of the Wanaka Township, you will sit in the lap of luxury and watch the uninterrupted mountain views as the scent of fresh flowers fills your suite. Regional flavors, such as wine and produce, welcome you into the decadent confines of the lodge. The lupines sway in the lake breeze. The mountain range stretches around you. Let the luxury surround you and the romance overtake you.

dayInfo.title: Wanaka – It’s Better with a Chill
dayInfo.description: Snuggle up close as today you will venture into the chilly depths of a Siberian adventure. Your journey begins with an airplane flight into the remote Siberia Valley. New Zealand’s wilderness expands beneath you as rugged mountains ascend, glaciers glow in the sunlight, mountain lakes glisten turquoise, and hanging valleys sprawl beneath the foothills. The plane lands in the heart of the Siberian Valley where you can walk towards the crystal clear and clearly cold waters of Siberia Stream. Follow your guide and the river into the impressive beech forest. The trees are thin and emanate the scent of juniper. The sound of babbling water is replaced by birdsongs, until the trees disperse and you begin your jet-boat safari. Speed through the Wilkin Valley with the fresh air blowing through your hair, the sweet, cool mist on your cheeks, and the vibrant grass swaying in the alpine breeze. As the day comes to an end you can look back at the mountain range, having seen the breathtaking beauty of the Siberian Valley, and know that there will always be more splendor ahead.

dayInfo.title: Doubtful Sound – A Tender Cruise
dayInfo.description: Today you will venture through the windy, golden scenery of Crown Range and make your way to Manapouri where you will begin your cruise through the breathtaking Doubtful Sound. The three-mast cruise liner will set sail along the opulent waters of the sound. The lush mountains plunge deep into the water’s depths, and loom tall above the water’s surface, dwarfing the ship and you along with it. Doubtful Sound is filled with serene silence. The water is calm across the meandering foothills. Waterfalls careen down the mountainsides. The beauty of Doubtful Sound is unique, tranquil, and dreamlike. The sunset changes the sky from blue to magenta until the sunlight melts behind the mountains. When night blankets over the sound, the twinkling of stars brightens the sky and reflects on the water’s surface. The Milky Way swirls around the stars and the sound giving you an unparalleled view of the night sky, Doubtful Sound, and life’s ineffable wonders.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – The Beauty of the Royal Treatment
dayInfo.description: The crisp morning air surrounds the boat as you cruise back to the Manapouri. The subtle crash of waterfalls dissipates and you are on your way to the luxurious alpine city of Queenstown. Settled between the opulence of Lake Wakatipu and the foothill of Bob’s Peak, the Remarkables Mountain Range wraps around the far side of the lake, its white-tipped peaks piercing the sky like a line of pillows. Enjoy the comforts and charm of your lodge located in a private corner that offers sensational views of the lake, the Remarkables, and the city itself. The breeze flutters in from off the water. The Remarkables sparkle in the distance and the main street of Queenstown is a close walk away. The bustling heart of Queenstown feels more like an alpine village than a city; the streets are decorated with gaslights, the stores sport pinewood facades, and the mountains are visible in almost any direction.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Stunning Simplicity
dayInfo.description: Take in the luscious scenery around Queenstown on a jet-boat cruise of Dart River. Speed through the glistening blue water of the Dart River as mountains tower around you. The peaks practically extend to the riverbanks, giving way quickly to rocky shores. The untouched air of the valley surrounds you, perfumed with fresh water and pine. As you disembark from the boat you will be guided through the ancient forests, where beech trees spire high, unchanged for millennia. The sound of chirping birds and rushing water lingers among the trees. The scent of juniper drifts from the bark. The trees hide the mountains, the river disappears, and you make your way through paradise. The rich green fields, the stunning clear lakes, and the quant township rest in the quiet as you travel the roads back to Queenstown.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Together Through It All
dayInfo.description: With your last full day in Queenstown ahead of you there is no reason not to experience the romantic landscapes of New Zealand one last time on a scenic flight over Fiordland National Park, home to the famous Milford Sound. The sound from above is breathtaking as you soar over the waterways and mountaintops. Mitre Peak sits below you with snow-capped opulence as Sutherland Falls thunders down the mountainside being fed from the crater’s lake at the top. You can practically hear the water crashing down the mountain over the thump of propellers. The helicopter lands on one of the many glaciers in Fiordland National Park where you are able to explore the ancient, frozen water. It shines turquoise and white in the bright sun. The craggy terrain looks like a frozen river with crevices and tunnels hidden at every turn. The snow is cold on your skin and the sight is unparalleled. The sound of crunched ice comes from your stomping feet before you board the helicopter and ascend, once again, into the air. Moonlight and Shotover Canyon sit below you, the rushing water flowing jade and white, the trees rustling in the wind. As you set down in Queenstown you know that there is no end to the exceptional romance of the New Zealand landscape.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – The Dream Continues
dayInfo.description: Today you will transfer to the Queenstown Airport. The majesty of New Zealand has been explored, tasted, and experienced over the past 16 days. The warm sandy beaches, the cold glacial lakes, the thundering waterfalls, and the rolling mountaintops have given you non-stop excitement. The soft beds, decadent wines, friendly people, and delicious food have given you non-stop luxury. Your journey through New Zealand may be coming to an end, but as you ascend over the calm waters of the Pacific you know that the honeymoon never has to stop. If you really don't want your time in New Zealand to end, consider adding on to your trip. Be sure to read the travel reviews for New Zealand luxury tours section.

tourName: Marvelous Highlights Tour of New Zealand’s South Island
placesVisited: Queenstown, Franz Josef Glacier, Westhaven Inlet
generalInfo: From tropics to fjords, experience the ultimate island immersion into nature on this one-week tour of New Zealand’s South Island. This is an exclusive itinerary that includes Fjordland, Franz Josef, Abel Tasman, and Kahurangi National Parks. Handcrafted with three distinctive natural realms, you will helicopter and hike into the wild and escape into landscapes that are rarely encountered by visitors.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Shotover River and Middle-Earth
dayInfo.description: After touching down in Queenstown, you will be transferred to your boutique hotel in the heart of the city. Early check-in will be arranged so that you can freshen up and head straight to the Shotover River. A barren canyon of dramatic corners and turquoise water, this river is best explored on a jet boat. This is a fast-paced and exciting ride that will have you rushing down the river. After your river adventure, you can indulge in a private 4WD vehicle tour into a wilderness that inspired Middle-earth. Your guide can help you customize your exact route based on your hiking and adventure preferences.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Private Helicopter Tour
dayInfo.description: Almost all of Fiordland National Park is inaccessible by road or hiking trail. You will need a helicopter to really explore. An experienced mountain rescue pilot will fly you over glaciers, fjords, and into this wilderness on a day of mesmerizing landscapes. You will soon touch down and walk on the ice. You will be able to appreciate the national park’s scale and spend time among its intimate details. Few people have ever ventured where you will be going today. It is this solitude and exclusivity that makes a private helicopter tour the ultimate means of exploring Fiordland.

dayInfo.title: Franz Josef Glacier – World Heritage Te Wahipounamu
dayInfo.description: The journey from Queenstown to Franz Josef Glacier is about four hours by road, but it is an incredible journey. This is the ultimate New Zealand road trip because it traverses four national parks and the distinctive zones of Te Wahipounamu. You will be privately chauffeured, so there are countless places that you can stop and explore along the way, from unknown trails to mountain viewpoints. This will be a very different style of expedition when compared to yesterday’s adventure. South Island roads are always quiet. When nature is so unique, journeys like this become the experience and not just a means of travel.

dayInfo.title: Franz Josef Glacier – Hiking a Wild Glacier
dayInfo.description: Two glaciers crash through the forest on this part of the coast, and these two natural landmarks are far more impressive than photos can suggest. After a helicopter approach, you will hike on Franz Josef Glacier, crunching across ice and snow with experienced guides. Majestic ice sculptures and tunnels showcase nature’s artistic power, and flowing ice fields demonstrate the endless scale of the wilderness. Even the lush forest is baffling in person. Later today, you will explore a wildlife sanctuary with a conservationist and search for the rare kiwi bird. You should get up-close encounters and learn about the species’ survival.

dayInfo.title: Westhaven Inlet – Kayak along the Coast
dayInfo.description: You will complete your overland journey this morning. As you travel, the road will twist along the coastline to Westhaven Inlet. After fjords and snow, you will now explore the South Island’s tropical allure. Lush colors extend beneath your lodge, and your sense of solitude will be at its height. A guide will accompany you on a kayaking excursion along the coast, which will give you the chance to paddle alongside dolphins.
